feed.subtitle: What's up with Blogger development and servers
feed.title: Blogger Status

entry.content:
We have received reports from users not being able to create or edit posts. We are working on fixing this. In the meantime, you can change your language settings to English as a workaround. Thanks for your patience.


Update, 9:45AM PST: This has been fixed, thanks for your patience.

Blogger will go into read-only mode Wednesday (8/10) 5:00PM PST for about an hour as we work to expand capacity for our users. Thanks in advance.

Update, 6:10PM: The maintenance is complete, thanks for your patience.

We're investigating reports of 503 errors this morning, and hope to have the issue resolved shortly. We'll update this thread once we have more information to share.

Update, 2:00PST: This has been resolved, thanks for your patience.

Image Uploads will be temporarily disabled for about two hours while we perform routine maintenance on Monday, June 6th at 5:00PM PDT.

However, you will still be able to add photos to your blog via the From this blog and From PWA tab of the uploader. We'll update this post as soon as the maintenance is complete.

(This has been moved forward one day from the originally-scheduled date of June 7th)


Update, 7:00PM: The maintenance is now complete. Thanks for your patience.

Blogger Incident Report
By Eddie Kessler, Tech Lead/Manager, Blogger

(This is a follow-up to the original post we made on Blogger Buzz about this incident.)

On Wednesday, May 11 at 10:00pm PDT, Blogger entered a one-hour scheduled maintenance period to make improvements to increase service reliability. Unfortunately, errors made during this period had the opposite effect. This report describes what we were doing, what went wrong, how we fixed it, and what we’re doing to help prevent these types of problems from happening again.

We sincerely apologize for the impact of this incident on Blogger’s authors and readers.

What we were doing

Blogger maintains replicas (copies) of blogs in multiple locations so if one copy becomes unavailable — maybe due to a cut network cable or loss of power — blogs continue to remain accessible. During this maintenance period we attempted to add several more replicas to both increase redundancy (which helps make the service more robust) and capacity (so we can serve more blogs to more people).

The procedure required a read-only period (no new posts, comments, or blogs) while we added the new replicas. The procedure appeared to go smoothly, and just after 10:30pm PDT we allowed new blogs, posts, and comments.  We then noticed a higher than usual rate of errors being reported and quickly realized that the new replicas were missing data.

What went wrong

Next, we reverted the service upgrades and removed the newly introduced replicas. During this process we discovered that running Blogger with the bad replicas had caused some user data to become inaccessible. This manifested itself in a number of ways including some blogs appeared to have been replaced, others wouldn’t display, and some users couldn’t access their dashboard.

Fixing the problem

After several hours of examining different strategies to address the data problems we decided to restore Blogger data from our backup systems. First we had to restore the data from backups to our serving infrastructure and then we had to recover all the posts, pages, and comments that had been made since the backup was taken.

While we restored the service from backup, Blogger remained in read-only mode for just over 10 hours, after which the majority of blogs returned to normal. The backup, however, had some inconsistencies that affected a very small percentage of blogs.  Also, the process used to migrate posts immediately after restoration had some unforeseen side-effects that we had to address.

Once we had all the blogs restored, we put our energy toward removing inconsistencies and gradually restoring posts, pages and comments. This required detailed work, and we focused on being meticulous to make sure that we didn't create any additional issues.

Lessons learned and preventative actions

We’ve learned a lot in a short period of time about how to manage failures in our maintenance and recovery processes. We’ve identified multiple areas to fix and improve — including better tools for repairing inconsistencies in our data store, defensive elements in our software to guard against corruption, better backup and restore procedures, and some procedural changes for maintenance that would have prevented the initial issue. We also outlined how we can improve our communication with Blogger users should something like this occur again, which would include more consistent updates on the user forum.

During this time, we received messages of support from some users for which we are very grateful. Blogger users have spent countless hours creating blogs that are amazing, creative, important, and personal. Those hours have weighed heavily on us, and for all the anxiety and frustration that this incident caused some Blogger users, we sincerely apologize.

We are committed to swiftly fixing the problems and using our lessons learned to try to make sure that this type of issue doesn't happen again.
Blogger is back now. We're still working on restoring some of the data. For more details, see this post: http://buzz.blogger.com/2011/05/blogger-is-back.html
We’ve started restoring the posts that were temporarily removed and expect Blogger to be back to normal soon.
To get Blogger back to normal, all posts since 7:37am PDT on Weds, 5/11 have been temporarily removed. We expect everything to be back to normal soon. Sorry for the delay.
Blogger will be in read-only mode while we resolve some maintenance issues. Sorry for the inconvenience.
Blogger will go into read-only mode Wednesday (5/11) 10:00PM PST for about an hour for maintenance.

We've identified a problem rendering some blogs containing the popular posts widget.  Our engineers are fixing the issue and the it should be resolved shortly.

Thanks for your patience in the mean time.

Postmortem for Blogger Service Interruption on March 16

By Jinwoo Lee, Blogger Software Engineer

As we committed to you, when serious service interruptions occur we will provide you details about what went wrong and what we’re doing to help prevent similar problems in the future.

From about 9:55 AM PDT until about 10:20 AM on Wednesday, March 16, all Blogger users were unable to access the Blogger dashboard page at www.blogger.com and draft.blogger.com. No data was lost and blogspot was not affected at all, so your blog’s readers weren’t impacted.

We made brief status updates on our Twitter account — this and this. Meanwhile, we kept a close eye on the reports coming through our help forum and Twitter stream.

The problem was caused by human error. We wanted to show a small announcement on the Blogger dashboard and our code for it had a bug, which caused the problem. Once we figured this out, we quickly reverted the change.

We are truly sorry for any inconveniences this might have caused you. In the meantime, we will try harder to make Blogger a more reliable service.

Image Uploads will be disabled for about two hours while we perform routine maintenance on Wednesday, October 20th at 5:00PM PDT.  

We'll update this post as soon as the maintenance is complete.

Update, 6:30PM: This is now complete and uploads are back online. Thanks for your patience.

We're currently working through multiple issues which are affecting the reliability of our comment system. We'll update this post as soon as we have more information to share.

Thanks for your patience in the meantime.

Update: This has been resolved.

Post Mortem for Blogger Service Interruption June 7

By Eddie Kessler, Blogger Engineering Manager

As we recently committed to you, when serious service interruptions occur, we will provide you details about what went wrong and what we're doing to help prevent similar problems in the future.

From about 12:30 AM PST on Monday, June 7 until about 12:30 PM, a significant subset of Blogger users, mostly in the US Midwest, were unable to post to their blogs. No data was lost and blogspot was largely unaffected, so your blog’s readers weren’t impacted.

We posted the issue on the Blogger Status blog, and we made a brief status update on our Twitter account as well. Meanwhile, we kept a close eye on the reports coming through our help forum and Twitter stream.

The problem was caused by human error. One of our datacenters inadvertently had the wrong server configuration when we performed our regular service update. Once we figured this out, we corrected the problem quickly.

We are in the process of adding additional monitoring that will prevent this kind of outage from recurring.

We are truly sorry for any inconveniences this might have caused you. In the meantime, we will try harder to make Blogger a more reliable service.

We're aware of isolated access issues in certain regions within the US. We're investigating this now and will follow-up as soon as we have more information to share

Thanks for your patience in the meantime.

Update, 12:30 PST: This is now fixed.

Our image backend is experiencing problems which may affect the display and/or uploading of photos. We are working to resolve this and will update this post when we have more information.

More info can be found here in the Picasa Help Forum.

Update, 3/29 2:00PST: This is resolved. Thanks for your patience.

The Following feature will be read-only for planned maintenance for about two hours starting Monday (1/25) at 2:00PM PDT. Any new Followers or other Friend Connect changes may not save during this time.

Users are experiencing problems playing videos in Blogger blogs. We are investigating and will send an update when fixed.

Update 1/22: This is now fixed. Thanks for your patience.

Image uploads will be unavailable Monday (11/23) at 4:00PM PDT for about 30 minutes for maintenance.


Update: This is now complete. Thanks for your patience.

Postmortem on recent issues affecting users in Europe

What happened
Beginning at approximately 2:30am (PDT) Saturday, October 31, a DNS configuration issue in a new datacenter in Europe caused requests to blogger.com and *.blogspot.com to be sent to an invalid IP address. Affected users throughout Europe were unable to connect to either Blogger or to blogs hosted by Blogger at blogspot.com for approximately 10 hours.

What we're doing about it
1. Blogger's systems engineers will proactively monitor and verify DNS settings during major system changes.
2. We have improved our automated monitoring so that on-call engineers will be paged earlier for DNS-related failures.
3. Checks in our DNS management system have been made to prevent the change that caused this to occur.

Eddie Kessler, Blogger Engineering Manager

RESOLVED: The issue affecting Blogger users in Europe has been resolved. There was a configuration problem in a new datacenter. We will provide a postmortem on Monday. Thanks to all who assisted us analyzing the problem.
We are receiving reports that some users cannot access Blogger in Europe. We are investigating.
Blogger was unavailable for most users for over an hour. Service has now been restored.

Blogger will be unavailable Monday (6/15) at 12:00AM PDT for about 10 minutes for maintenance.


Update: The maintenance is now complete. Thanks for your patience.

Blogger will be unavailable Monday (5/25) at 2:00AM PDT for about 10 minutes for maintenance.


Update: The maintenance is now complete. Thanks for your patience.

Image uploading will be unavailable for the next half hour due to PicasaWeb maintenance.

Update: The maintenance is now complete. Thanks for your patience.

Due to an upcoming Picasa maintenance, image uploading will be unavailable for about 30 minutes on Tuesday, April 21 at 4:00PM PDT.

Update: This has been canceled and will be rescheduled for next week. We'll make a new post once we have a firm time set.
Blogger will be unavailable Thursday (4/16) at 2:00AM PDT for about 10 minutes for maintenance.

Image uploading will be unavailable for the next half hour or so due to PicasaWeb maintenance.

Update: The maintenance is now complete.

Blogger will be unavailable Wednesday (3/25) at 4:00PM PDT for about 10 minutes for maintenance.

Update: This maintenance has been moved to tomorrow, Thursday (3/26), at 4:00PM PDT.
Update: This is now complete. Thanks for your patience.

Blogger will be unavailable Thursday (3/19) at 4:00PM PDT for about 10 minutes for maintenance.

Update: This maintenance has been canceled.

Blogger will be undergoing maintenance Thursday, February 12th for about 30 minutes.

While most of Blogger should not be affected, we are expecting the image upload feature to be unavailable during this time.

Update: The maintenance is complete.

Blogger will be unavailable Wednesday (1/21) at 4:00PM PST for about 10 minutes for maintenance.

Update: The maintenance is now complete. Thank you for your patience.

Image upload failures have returned for some users. Blogger engineers are investigating.

Update, 12:05PM: This has been resolved.

We're currently experiencing issues with the photo upload feature which may prevent users from adding photos to their blogs.

We apologize for the inconvenience, and hope to have it resolved shortly.

Update: This is now fixed. Thanks for your patience.

The intermittent FTP publishing problems over the past few days have now been fixed. We are sorry for the inconvenience.

Update: the problems recurred but have now been fixed again, and should not recur.

Blogger will be unavailable Tuesday (10/14) at 8:00PM PDT for about 10 minutes for maintenance.

Update: This is now complete. Thanks for your patience.

Blogs on custom domains were intermittently unviewable tonight. This has now been resolved, and we apologize for the problems.

The Indic transliteration feature is currently having intermittent problems and we are working to resolve them as quickly as possible.

Update 1:23am: The Indic transliteration feature is now working. Thanks for bearing with us while we resolved these issues.
Blogger will be unavailable Thursday (9/25) at 4:00PM PDT for about 10 minutes for maintenance.

Recently, some of our users reported problems with editing, publishing and auto saving posts. We have released a fix which should prevent this from happening. If you still have problems, please try clearing your cache and cookies and try again. Sorry for the inconvenience and thank you for your patience.

Blogger will be unavailable Friday (8/8) at 4:00PM PDT for about 10 minutes for maintenance.

Update: This is now complete. Thanks for your patience.

Blogger will be unavailable Wednesday (8/6) at 6:00PM PDT for about 10 minutes for maintenance.

Update: This is now complete. Thanks for your patience.

Blogger will be unavailable Wednesday (8/6) at 4:00PM PDT for about 10 minutes for maintenance.

Update: This is now complete. Thanks for your patience.

The WMX integration on draft.blogger.com will be unavailable until after the maintenance at 4:00PM PDT on Wednesday (8/6). Sorry for the inconvenience and thank you for your patience.

Update: Sorry. :( Due to the emergency failover at 6:00PM PDT on Wednesday (8/6), this will be unavailable until another maintenance at 4:00PM PDT on Friday (8/8).

Blogger will be unavailable Tuesday (8/5) at 4:00PM PDT for about 10 minutes for maintenance.

Update: This is now complete. Thanks for your patience.

We're experiencing some issues with the photo upload feature, which may prevent the posting and displaying of some images. We're looking into this now and hope to have it resolved shortly.

Update: We have resolved this issue. Thanks for your patience.

Some blogs have been mistakenly marked as spam. Affected users are not able to post to their blog and received an email indicating Blogger classified their blog as spam. We are actively working to correct the issue.

Update: We have restored all blogs that were mistakenly marked as spam due to Friday's bug. If you are still unable to post to your blog, you can request a review by clicking Request Unlock Review on your Dashboard.

Blogger will be unavailable Friday (7/25) at 4:00PM PDT for about 10 minutes for maintenance.

Update: This is now complete. Thanks for your patience.

Blogger will be unavailable Tuesday (7/22) at 5:30PM PDT for about 10 minutes for maintenance.

Update: This is now complete. Thanks for your patience.

Blogger is undergoing maintenance Wednesday (7/9) which may affect the performance of the photo upload feature. Some images on Blog*Spot may also be unavailable. We apologize for the inconvenience.

Update: This is now complete. Thanks for your patience.

Blogger will be unavailable Tuesday (6/24) at 4:00PM PDT for about 10 minutes for maintenance.

Update: This is now complete. Thanks for your patience.

Blogger is currently experiencing problems with FTP publishing; we are aware of the problem and are working hard on a fix. We apologize for the inconvenience.

Update: The problem has been fixed.

We need to perform an emergency maintenance, which will cause Blogger to be unavailable for about 10 minutes, starting at 6:35 PDT. Sorry for the inconvenience.

Update: This is now complete. Thanks for your patience.

Blogger will be unavailable Monday (6/23) at 4:00PM PDT for about 10 minutes for maintenance.

Update: This is now complete. Thank you for your patience.

Blogger will be unavailable Friday (6/20) at 3:00PM PDT for about 10 minutes for maintenance.

Update: This maintenance is being delayed a bit while we work out some issues.

Update: We've decided to delay this maintenance until Monday. Thank you for your patience.

Blogger will be unavailable Thursday (6/19) at 2:00PM PDT for about 10 minutes for maintenance.

Update: This is now completed. Thanks for your patience.

Due to maintenance, the photo upload feature will be down for about 30 minutes at 3:00 pm PDT. Some images on Blog*Spot may also be unavailable. We apologize for the inconvenience.

Update: The maintenance is now over. We appreciate your patience.

Blogger is currently experiencing problems with FTP publishing. Our engineers are working on the problem and hope to have it resolved soon. We apologize for the inconvenience.

Update: The problem has been fixed.

Due to maintenance, the photo upload feature will be down for 15 minutes at 3:30 pm PDT. Some photos on Blog*Spot may also be unavailable. We apologize for the inconvenience.

Update: The maintenance is over and lasted for 6 minutes. Thanks for your patience.
Blogger and Blog*Spot had very high page load times and server errors for about an hour this morning, from 6–7 AM PDT. We’ve fixed the problem. Everything should be operating smoothly now.

Blogger is currently experiencing problems with FTP publishing. We are looking into the problem and apologize for the inconvenience.

Update, 6 PM: This is now under control.

Blogger is currently experiencing problems with video. We're working hard on a fix and will post an update when the problem is resolved.

Update, 5 PM: This has now been fixed. Thanks for your patience.
Due to maintenance, the photo upload feature may be unreliable this weekend (5/17 - 5/18). We apologize for the inconvenience.

Blogger and Blog*Spot been having performance problems (slow / non-loading pages) on-and-off since 11AM. Our engineers are working on the issue.

Update, 6:30: This is now under control.

Update, 4PM: The feed problem has been fixed.

We have noticed a small number of blogs have broken feeds and are seeing the following bX codes when going to their feeds' URL:
  • bX-z8kqgm
  • bX-391dlh
We are working hard to fix the problem.

Some users may be seeing star ratings on their posts without having opted in to this new feature. This is an experimental feature that was accidentally enabled on some users' blogs. We're currently working to remove star ratings on all affected blogs. In the future, you'll be able to choose to opt-in to this feature; it won't appear automatically.

Update: The Star Rating feature has been disabled for the moment.

Blogger will be unavailable Thursday (4/24) at 4:00PM PDT for about 10 minutes for maintenance.

Update: The maintenance is complete. Thanks for your patience.

Blogger will be unavailable Wednesday (4/23) at 4:00PM PDT for about 10 minutes for maintenance.

Update: The maintenance is complete. Thank you for your patience.

The photo upload feature is currently unreliable. We are working on the problem and will post an update when the problem is resolved.

Update: Photo uploading is still having intermittent problems. If you experience an error during uploading, please wait a few minutes and try again. We'll get things working smoothly as soon as possible.

Blogger will be unavailable Thursday (3/13) at 5:00PM PDT for about 10 minutes for maintenance.

Update: We have completed the maintenance. Thank you for your patience.

Blogger will be unavailable Wednesday (3/12) at 7:00PM PDT for about 10 minutes for maintenance.

Update: This has been rescheduled to Thursday (3/13).

Blogger and Blog*Spot are currently slow, read-only, and/or down. Our engineers are working on it.

Update: this has been resolved.

Blogger and Blog*Spot will be unavailable Wednesday (2/27) at 6:00PM PST for about 10 minutes for maintenance.

Update: The maintenance is complete.

Blogger will be unavailable Wednesday (1/30) at 4:30PM PST for about 10 minutes for maintenance.

Update: The maintenance is complete.

Blogger will be unavailable Monday (1/28) at 4:00PM PST for about 10 minutes for maintenance.

Update: The maintenance is complete.

This afternoon, many blogs showed the error bX-uxu3fu for about two to three hours. This was caused by a bug in our latest release that affected highly-customized Layouts templates. We noticed the problem as soon as the release finished deploying, and worked quickly to find and fix the bug.

We apologize to the bloggers and readers of the affected blogs.

Clarification and details update, 1/18:
Yesterday afternoon, we deployed an update to Blogger including new features and bug fixes. Immediately after the update, we discovered that one of the bug fixes had introduced a new bug which blocked people from viewing a small number of blogs with certain highly-customized Layouts templates. We immediately began to deploy a fix, but viewers of the affected blogs may have seen an internal error (bX-uxu3fu) for a period of a few hours during the redeployment.

We make every effort to test changes prior to deployment. Testing against every possible customized template is impossible, so we do our best to test the most used features. Unfortunately, this one slipped through our procedures. We apologize to the affected bloggers and their readers. We're adding new test cases to our procedures to catch this and similar issues in the future.

Video upload is currently not working. Our engineers are working to fix it.

Update, 9:30AM: This has been fixed.

Invitations to team blogs and private blogs are currently returning error code bX-tgu0qs. We're investigating.

Update: This error code is also appearing when logging in via the comment form.

Update (16:30 PST): This should mostly be fixed, though there are some lingering issues with Internet Explorer 6, which we're still working on. If that affects you, you should still be able to use these features from another browser, such as Firefox.
Blogger is currently experiencing issues with video upload. Our engineers are working on it. Thank you for your patience.

Blogger is currently having trouble publishing to a number of FTP hosts. We're investigating and will update as the situation develops. Thanks for your patience.

Update: This issue was fixed on 11/6 at 8:30PM PST.

Blogger will be unavailable Tuesday (11/6) at 11:00PM PST for about 10 minutes for maintenance.


Update (11:10PM): The maintenance is over and lasted for about 8 minutes.

Blogger’s video upload is currently down. Our engineers are working on the problem.

Update, 7PM: Video upload has been restored to full functionality.

Update, 8:15PM: After being fixed for a bit, video uploads are failing again, languishing in a “processing” state. Blogger engineers are working to resolve this.

Update, 9:15PM: We have identified the root problem and resolved it. Video uploading now works as normal.

Blogger engineers are currently investigating problems with photo uploading, which is manifesting as the “bX-9pjt6o” error code when clicking on the image upload button.

Update, 9:00PM: This has been fixed. Photo uploading has resumed to normal operation.

Blogger will be unavailable Wednesday (10/17) at 4:00PM PDT for about 10 minutes for maintenance.

Update (4:23PM): The maintenance is over and lasted for about 3 minutes.
Blogger will be unavailable Monday (10/15) at 4:00PM PDT for about 10 minutes for maintenance.

Blogger and Blog*Spot will be unavailable Monday (9/10) at 11:00PM PDT for about 10 minutes for maintenance.

Update (11:07PM): The maintenance is over and lasted for about 6 minutes.

Some images uploaded through Blogger are appearing as broken images on blogs. We will be investigating this issue closely and hope to resolve it soon.

Update, 9:45AM: This issue was not nearly as widespread as we first thought and has been resolved.

Blogger and Blog*Spot suffered 10 minutes of extremely long page loads and posting errors this afternoon, starting at about 4:15PM. Both Blogger and Blog*Spot have returned to full service, and we have identified the cause of the problem and can prevent it in the future.

entry.title: Blogger and Blog*Spot outage this morning

link.title: Blogger and Blog*Spot outage this morning

entry.content:
Blogger and Blog*Spot had an unexpected outage for an hour this morning, starting around 7AM PDT. As of 8AM, all but a few blogs are working properly again.

We apologize profusely for this interruption in service.

Blogger and Blog*Spot will be unavailable Monday (8/20) at 4:00PM PDT for about 10 minutes for maintenance.

Update (4:08PM): The maintenance is over and lasted for about 3 minutes.

Tomorrow, Picasa will have a scheduled maintenance, which might affect image uploading and viewing. The maintenance is scheduled for the afternoon of 7/25, between 11 AM and 6 PM PDT.

Update (7/26): This has been fixed.

Some users are reporting that they are unable to enter titles for their posts. We are currently investigating this problem and working on a fix. In the meantime, please try moving your mouse pointer to the top edge of the title field instead of positioning the pointer at the center of the title field, in order to select the title field and enter a title for your post.

Update (7/10): This has been fixed.

RESOLVED: We're in the process of tracking down (and fixing) a problem you may be seeing, involving switching from Edit HTML to Compose mode in Blogger's Post Editor, as well as saving some settings. Image Upload may be affected as well - we'll update this post once we know more about the issue.

Update, 12:30PM: we have fixed the problem and saving settings should work properly.

Blogger and Blog*Spot will be unavailable Friday June 1 at 4:00PM PDT for about 10 minutes for maintenance.

Update (4:12PM): The maintenance is over and lasted for about 3 minutes.
Blogger and Blog*Spot were temporarily unavailable today between 1:56AM PDT and 2:20AM PDT due to an unexpected software problem. Things should be back to normal, we apologize for the inconvenience.

RESOLVED: Some Safari and Opera users are experiencing difficulties saving or previewing posts and uploading images. We are aware of this problem and currently working on a fix.

Update, 9PM: Apologies to those affected. We have fixed the bugs that were affecting Safari and Opera. Autosave and photo uploading should now be working correctly.

We also took this opportunity to fix the bug that we think was the root of the mysteriously-disabled comments problem that some of you were experiencing.

Update, Sunday: We’ve been able to reproduce a second comment settings bug. Until this is fixed, if you notice the comments link disappearing from your posts, toggle open the “Post Options” at the bottom of the post editor and re-enable comments.

Update, later on Sunday: We’ve fixed the bug that was disabling comments on posts saved as drafts.

Some of our users in Singapore are having problems posting to their blogs. It appears to be a problem with their ISP SingNet. We are in contact with SingNet to resolve the issue.
In the meantime, take a look at the workarounds suggested by a blogger and report the problem to SingNet's tech support.

Update, 05/18 10PM: We have been working with SingNet engineers to resolve the problem and we believe SingNet users should be able to use Blogger normally again. If you are a SingNet blogger and are experiencing trouble posting, please update this discussion.
Blogger and Blog*Spot were temporarily unavailable today between 1:47AM PDT and 2:11AM PDT due to an unexpected software problem. Things are now back to normal, we apologize for the inconvenience.

Blogger and Blog*Spot will be unavailable Friday May 11 at 4:00PM PDT for about 10 minutes for maintenance.

Update (4:20PM): The maintenance is over and lasted for 6 minutes.
Blogs hosted on custom domains were returning 404 errors for about a half an hour. This problem has been solved. All hosting is back to normal.
Some users have been seeing “403 Forbidden” errors since yesterday. We resolved the issue this morning.

Posting from the Picasa application in currently broken. We hope to have it fixed in a few hours.

(Update 4/27/07 3:21PM PST): Posting from the Picasa application should be working again.

We are currently experiencing some problems with Picasa Web Albums. As a result, some of you may have difficulty viewing your images. We hope to have everything back up shortly.

Update (5:51 PM PDT): Pictures should be loading properly again.

RESOLVED: We are seeing reports of uploaded images not appearing properly on blogs. We are investigating the issue.

Update (12:36AM): there was a problem introduced during the maintenance earlier today which has now been resolved. We apologize for the inconvenience.

Picasa Web Albums will be having some more maintanence this afternoon. Hopefully the outage will not last more than 30 minutes. During this time, photo uploading will be unavailable, and some older photos may not be available for viewing. We will post updates as we know more details.

(Update, 7:30PM PDT: Image uploading should be working again).

New Blogger and Blog*Spot will be briefly unavailable Thursday April 12 at 10:00PM PDT for about 5 minutes for maintenance.

Update (10:06PM): The maintenance is over and lasted 3:25 minutes.

Picasa Web Albums will be having two 5-20 minute outages tomorrow due for data center maintanence. During that time, users will not be able to upload photos, and some older photos may not be available for viewing.

We apologize for the inconvenience.

(Update, 11PM PDT: Bumped the time so that this post would appear at the top of Status)

(Update, 11:00AM PDT: Picasa Web Albums will be unavailable for the next 20 minutes)

(Update, 11:46AM PDT: Image uploading should be working again. We expect another short outage around 4:00PM).

We will have a 15 minutes outage on the old Blogger 8-8:15 pm PDT today. Blogspot and the new Blogger (where the majority of our users are now) will not be affected, except users will not be able to create new blogs on new Blogger during the outage.

We apologize for the short notice।

Update (8:16 pm PDT): This outage was completed successfully.

Update (8:45 pm PDT): We're actually now dealing with some fallout from the outage. If your blogs are on new Blogger, you can login directly here.

Update (8:46 pm PDT): While I was typing it looks like the other guys got it all fixed. Old Blogger is back to normal.

We will have a 60 minutes outage on the old Blogger 11-12 amPDT today. Blogspot and the new Blogger (where the majority of our users are now) will not be affected, except:
  • /start will redirect to the login page on the new Blogger
  • users will not be able to create new blogs on new Blogger during the outage.
We apologize for the short notice but we need to perform some emergency maintenance on the old Blogger system that requires this (partial) outage.

Update (11:40 PDT): the maintenance is complete.

Old Blogger might be reacting fairly slowly for some users, possibly also affecting users logging on into New Blogger. We are working on the issue. Blog*Spot should not be impacted.

Update (4 pm): this has been resolved.

Some users are seeing very slow responses or Status code 500 errors on old Blogger. Sometimes this is resolved by clearing blogger.com cookies. If you are trying to log in to new Blogger and cannot get to the Blogger homepage, you can login directly here: http://www2.blogger.com/login.g

Some of our users in Singapore can't view their blogs. The problem appears to be with their ISP. To help us work out the problem please read this message on the Blogger Help Group and respond if you have more information.
Update 3/28/2007: It appears that having received numerous error reports from Blogger and affected users in Singapore, Singnet has fixed this problem.

RESOLVED: Blogger is currently experiencing an unexpected, unplanned problem affecting reliability and speed of both Blog*Spot and New Blogger. We are investigating and working on resolving the problem.

Update: both Blogger and Blog*Spot have returned to normal as of 7:50PM PDT. An internal service tripped, adversely affecting Blogger. We are making sure this doesn't happen again.

RESOLVED: We're experiencing some issues with some users posting photos. This will most likely affect you if you have recently migrated or just created a new blog.

RESOLVED: Safari users and some FTP users may still be seeing some photo uploading problems. We apologize for the inconvenience and will have a fix out as soon as we can.

To clarify: both of these issues are RESOLVED now. Happy blogging.

We're experiencing some issues that affect mail-related features. All the mail messages will be queued and processed after the issue is resolved (expected in about 2 hours), so you may still use the mail-related features in the mean time, but may experience a noticeable delay.

Update: The new Blogger is back to normal; the old Blogger is still processing backlog. Sorry for the inconvenience and thank you for your continued patience.

RESOLVED: A fraction of old Blogger blogs are returning 403 Forbidden errors. All template images served from blogblog.com are also returning this error, resulting in broken templates. We apologize for this failure of old Blogger (you can see why we’re getting rid of it).

Issue history:
1:25PM: Blog*Spot blogs on old Blogger are returning 502 errors. Blogger engineers are identifying the problem and fixing it.

1:50PM: Most of old Blogger Blog*Spot has returned to full function. We now fixing the remaining problems.

2:25PM: Engineers are performing maintenance on a failed server. Expect return to full service rather soon.

2:35PM: Old Blog*Spot and templates have been restored to full functionality.

RESOLVED: We’re investigating network issues between Blog*Spot and a handful of British and Irish ISPs. Apologies to those who are affected and are unable to read blogs hosted at blogspot.com. There is no known workaround at this time.

Update, Thursday, 9:45AM: We’ve received word that this problem is at last fixed. For reals this time.

Update, Wednesday, 6PM: Reports continue to come in that this is not fixed for all cases. Our engineers are in contact with at least some of the ISPs and are working towards a solution. If you are experiencing this problem, please contact your ISP and also contribute to this thread on the Blogger Help Google Group and let us know who your ISP is. This information will help us fix this once and for all.

Update, Tuesday 10AM: This has been sorted out and fixed.

Update, Monday, 9:30AM: We’re hearing further reports that this problem is not solved, and there are indications that there is a misconfiguration in the affected ISPs’ routes. We appreciate your patience as we work with them to get this fixed for good.

Update, Sunday 4:25PM: We’ve instituted our own network workaround for this issue, which should resolve the problem for affected users. We’re following up with the ISPs to diagnose the root problem.

We’re looking into reports of “word verification” images (i.e. CAPTCHAs) not appearing on, for example, the comments page. If you come across a missing word verification image, the best workaround is to leave the answer field blank and submit your comment anyway. The page will reload — preserving your comment — with a new image that you can then solve and re-submit your comment.

Update, Saturday 11:45AM: We’ve tracked down one culprit for this which may be mis-matched session cookies due to a recent Blogger configuration change. The solution, at least for this case, is to close and re-open your browser.

Many Classic template blogs are seeing bX-sp4hmm error codes on their post pages since early this evening. Blogger engineers are testing a fix and will deploy it shortly.

We apologize for this failure in service.

Update, 10:30 PST: We had an unexpected conflict in some bug fixes to Classic template tags that caused this error. The fix for this problem is now propagating to all Blogger servers. Expect a return to full Blogger service within an hour.

Old blogger was down unexpectedly for about 20 mins at about 12:45PM PST. Everything is back to normal.

Blogspot and new Blogger were not affected.

Some users have been unable to publish via Mail-to-Blogger for the last few days. This is due to one particular faulty machine, and we're working on addressing the problem right now.

Update: This problem has been fixed and Mail-to-Blogger posting should work normally now. We are also changing the configuration of the mail servers to make this issue less likely to happen again.
From approximately 10:45PM PST (Monday 2/12), a small portion of blogs on the old Blogger were having issues. It was fixed at approximately 11:55PM PST.

There are problems with external publishing on the new Blogger. We are working on a fix. Thanks for your patience and we apologize for the inconvenience.

Update, 8:45: FTP publishing was running at a reduced rate since about 4:30AM today, followed by a total outage a little before 8AM.

We have repaired the system and it is publishing again. There’s a backlog of requests to publish in the queue, however, so expect some external publishing delays for possibly the rest of the morning. We will be monitoring the service closely while this continues.

New Blogger will have a brief outage tomorrow, Saturday 2/3, at 11AM for 10 minutes. This will affect both new Blogger and Blog*Spot blogs on new Blogger.

This maintenance is to address the unscheduled outages and performance problems of the past week.

Update, 11:30AM: Our maintenance is proceeding smoothly, and we will likely complete it with no outage at all. All of Blogger and Blog*Spot will remain functional. If we do have to interrupt service, it will be for a brief, 5–10 minutes sometime before noon.

Some users see the error code bX-vjhbsj when trying to view a blog. We have identified the source of this error and will push the fix to the site shortly. In the meantime, hitting Refresh in the browser may workaround the problem. We apologize for the inconvenience.

Update 10:50AM(PST): The issue has been fixed. Unfortunately pushing out the new build involved a few minutes outage. We apologize for trouble.

New Blogger has had troubles this morning, which you may have seen with slow requests and 502 error pages.

We are working on this and hope to get it resolved very soon.

Update, 1PM: These issues have been resolved. We are continuing to monitor and diagnose closely. We apologize for this morning’s poor performance.

You may still see 502 errors on occasion, but waiting a few seconds and reloading the page should work. This is mostly limited to a handful of blogs, however.

Publishing on the old Blogger was failing with "Error 550" since approximately 5:30PM PST. It was fixed at approximately 8:00PM PST.

New Blogger was unaffected. Sorry for the inconvenience.

We are currently investigating problems with Blog*Spot blogs on old Blogger. New Blogger blogs are not affected.

Update, 2:45: We've fixed this. All is back to normal.

Announcement: there is a scheduled outage for old Blogger next Tuesday, January 9th, from 7:45am-9:45am PST. You will not be able to post to old Blogger blogs or access any old Blogger blogs on Blog*Spot during this time. We also will not be allowing any new accounts or new blogs on new Blogger during this outage.

Update, 1/9 at 10:20AM: The maintenance is taking slightly longer for old Blogger. Almost all old Blogger Blog*Spot blogs are being served again, but the old Blogger application is still down.

Update, 1/9 at 11:25AM: Apologies for the continuing delay in bringing old Blogger back up. We are fixing a few lingering issues.

Update, 1/9 at 12:30PM: Old Blogger is now working again. You may need to close your browser and re-open it to pick up the DNS change.

We apologize sincerely for the unexpected extension of the outage.

New Blogger is currently experiencing issues with:
  • team blogs: non-admin team members are seeing errors when trying to post
  • mail2blogger: it's acting up and we're looking into why
  • blogger mobile: same issue as mail2blogger
Thanks for your patience - we'll have these fixed asap.

Update: these issues have been fixed.

Some users are seeing forbidden (403) messages instead of their blogspot blogs. We are aware of this problem and are working on it.

Update, 4:40 am: This issue has been resolved.

Users on the new Blogger are seeing intermittent 500 Server Error pages. We are working to repair this.

Update, 12:01PM: We believe that this problem is taken care of, but we are continuing to monitor closely.

There will be a scheduled maintenance of Blogger Mobile for unclaimed mobile blogs on the old version Blogger at noon on Tuesday, 12/19/2006, expected to last for the entire day.

Update (12/19/2006 12:05PM): This is now starting.
Update (12/20/2006 16:14PM): This has now finished.

Old Blogger is currently down. The new version of Blogger in beta and Blog*Spot are unaffected. We are investigating.

Update, 5PM: This has been fixed.

We are diagnosing and fixing problems with the new version of Blogger in beta right now. Users are seeing 502 server errors when posting to blogs on the beta, and the site’s overall performance is poor.

Update, 3PM: We have fixed the current problem, and are continuing to monitor things closely to prevent relapse. We apologize for the lapse in service.

Some users on the beta may experience icons disappearing on the post editor and/or trouble uploading images. Cleaning the browser's cache or on Windows force reloading the page by pressing Ctrl-F5 fixes this problem.

There is no planned outage today at 3PM. Some of you may be seeing a warning for it, but that’s because our outage warning system is falling back to a hard-coded default. We’ll get this fixed presently.

We are currently investigating the intermittent 502 error pages on the new version of Blogger in beta and its Blog*Spot blogs. If you experience one of these errors, waiting a minute or so and refreshing may help.

Update, 11AM Friday: This was cleared up last evening.

Until tonight’s mini-outage of the Blogger beta at 8PM PST, the following problems will be seen on the beta:
  • Mail-to-Blogger and Blogger Mobile postings will not publish. They will publish eventually, however, after 8PM.
  • FTP blogs will publish, but the spinny status will not reflect this in the interface. It will instead spin forever.
We apologize for these issues. Everything will be as normal after 8PM.

Update, 8:45PM: The outage completed a little while ago and was mostly successful, with downtime of 5 minutes for the beta and its Blog*Spot. Some blogs were returning 502 error pages for about 15 minutes after the rest of the service returned. All FTP, email, and mobile publishing is now back to normal.

There will be a small outage for the new version of Blogger and its Blog*Spot blogs tonight at 7PM, lasting 5 minutes.

Update, 9:45pm: the outage had to be postponed to tomorrow (Wednesday) 10:00am Pacific Time.

Update, 12:42PM Wednesday: This morning’s outage went fine (6 mins for beta, 8 mins for Blog*Spot), though special circumstances knocked this very Status blog (and only Status) for longer than that. There will be a followup outage tonight at 8PM, PST, of roughly 5 minutes.

We’ll be doing planned maintenance on the new version of Blogger in beta tomorrow (Thursday). This will require two small outages, one at 12:30PM PST and the other after 3PM PST. Neither outage should last more than 10 minutes. beta.blogger.com and Blog*Spot blogs on the new version of Blogger will be unavailable during the outages. We apologize for these interruptions.

Update, 12:45 Thursday: We've completed the first outage. We've adjusted the time for the second outage to some time after 3PM but before 4PM. Also, the beta and beta blogs will run a little pokey until the second outage.

Update, 1PM Thursday: Non-beta blogs are currently showing 502 server errors. We are investigating this problem and hope to have a fix shortly.

Update, 1:10PM Thursday: Non-beta Blog*Spot is working correctly again. We apologize for this unanticipated side-effect of the planned maintenance.

Update, 3:25PM Thursday: We just completed the second outage. The new version of Blogger is returning to normal. Thanks for your patience surrounding these two brief interruptions, and apologies for the brief unplanned outage of current Blogger's Blog*Spot.

Blog*Spot blogs on the current version of Blogger are showing 500 errors. Our engineers are investigating. Blogger.com and blogs on the new version of Blogger are unaffected.

Update 7:37 PM(PST): This has been fixed.

Some users on the new version of Blogger in beta are seeing error messages when they publish posts. The posts are still published successfully, however. We have a fix coming, but in the meantime turning off the “Ping Weblogs.com” Publishing setting should prevent the error from occurring.

Update: This problem has been fixed.

Blogger will go down for maintenance on Sunday 4pm PDT. This maintenance will last 45 minutes.

Update: This maintenance is now complete. Thank you for your patience.

Photo uploading is having problems currently on www.blogger.com. We are working on fixing the problem.
Update 2:45 PM (PST): The issue has been fixed.

There are currently problems with photo uploading, we are working on fixing them.

Update 11:40 AM(PST): This issue has been resolved.

We have been working through a series of publishing issues since Saturday morning. The problems have been transient: for some users they were more frequent than for others. We are still working to resolve this completely and will post updates. Blogger beta has not been affected.

Update: this has been fixed.

There are problems with publishing to blogs. We are working on fixing this. Blogs on the beta are not affected.

Update 9:14 AM (PST): Publishing works now, expect some slowness though as we wrap up fixing this issue.

Update 16:52 PST: Blogger is inaccessible due to a problematic piece of networking hardware - it should be fixed soon.

Update 17:00 PST: The networking issue has been fixed.

Sincere apologies for the short notice but we will take down both blogger.com and blogspot.com at 2 PM PST today to replace the piece of network equipment that was causing the outages in the past couple of weeks. The outage will last 60-90 minutes, we will try to get done as fast as we can. Blogger beta will be not affected nor blogs that are hosted on the beta except for a few static images that we pull from www.blogger.com.

Update 3:30 PM (PST): blogger and blogspot are back up (you may need to restart your browser to pick up the DNS change).

We experienced an outage this evening due to a problem in our networking hardware, sigh!. This caused our users to lose access to both Blogger and BlogSpot for some time. This has been fixed and things should be back to normal.

We are experiencing some troubles with one filer. This affects publishing to some of the blogs and they will not be available for viewing on blogspot.

Update: The issue has been fixed. Thanks for your patience.

Tomorrow we will have an outage of 60 minutes from 2p to 3p (Pacific Time) as we perform some hardware repairs.

Update: This maintenance was completed successfully.

Wow. Ok. So it hasn’t been Blogger’s weekend. Blogger was down for a little over three hours this evening, due to the near-simultaneous failure of a critical component and its backup. This outage also impacted the loading of many Blog*Spot blogs, which rely on Blogger for a CSS file.

We apologize profusely for this outage. Blogger should be working as normal now. The new version of Blogger in beta was not affected.

We’ve been having a bit of slowness this morning. Technicians are on the scene. Update, 11:15: Most of the problems are resolved. Thanks for sticking with us through the maintenance. Blogger will be running a bit slower than normal for a short time (possibly for the rest of today) as we have a handful of servers out of commission. If you see any error pages, please just wait a sec and try again.
Apologies to everyone affected by tonight's Blogger slowness. And super apologies that said slowness prevented us from updating this page in a timely manner.

Some users are experiencing problems with uploaded photos (truncation or not showing at all). We are investigating this problem. If you experience any of these issues please report the blog and image urls to Blogger Support.
Update 9 PM (PST): This problem has been resolved.

Blogger and Blogspot were down between 5:30 and 7:30 PST this morning due to a network malfunction. We apologize for the inconvenience and the fact that this blog was not updated earlier, but since this blog is also served by Blogger, updating it was of little use.

Blogger beta is currently unreachable. We are working to fix this issue. We regret the inconvenience caused to our beta users. This does not affect our users on Blogger (http://www.blogger.com).

Update: Blogger beta should be back up for everyone within an hour.

Blogger's performance has been sluggish this morning. The culprit seems to be a bunch of spammers creating spam blogs at a high-rate. We are locking the spam creators out from Blogger and monitoring the system to see that there are no other issues. Thanks for your patience.

Update 2:55 PM (PST): This issue has been solved. Please report publishing problems to us if you still see them.

Update 10:00 PM (PST): Some users are still experiencing publishing trouble, we are working on figuring this one out. Again, apologies for the the continuing problems.

Update 10:44 PM (PST): We found the cause of the publishing problem, it's those spammers again. Normal publishing will be restored shortly.

Update 11:00 PM (PST): Publishing should now work normally.

Blogger will be down for maintenance tomorrow (Sep 21) for 45 minutes starting at 4pm (Pacific Time).

Update: The maintenance was completed successfully.

Blogger will be down for maintenance tomorrow for 15 minutes starting at 4pm (Pacific Time).

Update: The maintenance was completed successfully.

A small percentage of blogs will be down (both viewing and publishing) between 4:10pm and 4:20pm (PDT) as a part of clearing out today morning's blogspot issue.

Update: The downtime will now be sometime between 4:30 pm and 5:30 pm(PDT) for a short while. It should affect a very small percentage of blogs.
Update: The maintenance has been completed successfully.

After this morning's blogspot outage there are still a number of blogs that return an error page. We are working on restoring these blogs. Note that the posts of these blogs are accessible in blogger.com but the the published pages are temporarily down (so we did not lose your posts). We sincerely apologize for the downtown and will send updates as we have more information available.

Update (10:17 PDT): the blogs that had trouble are viewable now. If you still have trouble viewing your blog please notify Blogger support. Again, we apologize for the inconvenience.

Blogspot was down for about 30 minutes. It has been restored now, but some blog pages are still returning an error page. We are working on resolving the problem.

Update, 4:25AM: This issue has been fixed.

We are having some trouble on blogspot: some blogs return an error page. We are working on fixing this.

Update, 3:20PM: This issue has been fixed.

Posting to the Blogger Atom API (e.g. via a third-party website or desktop client) is not working properly. We are investigating.

Update, 11:24AM: This has been fixed.

One of our database servers has been malfunctioning this morning. We are working on diagnosing the problem.

Update: this issue has been resolved now.
Some more of those "no space left on device" errors are popping up this morning. We're working on getting them all cleared up right now.

Blogger users are experiencing slowness and occasional timeouts. We are working on diagnosing and fixing the problem.

Update: this problem has been fixed.

Some users are seeing a “001 java.io.IOException: No space left on device” error message when publishing to Blog*Spot. We’re on it.

Update, 1PM: This has been fixed.

Some password recovery emails are being sent out with incorrect links, which will cause an error when you try to click on them. We're working on getting this fixed soon, but in the meantime if this affects you, you may be able to work around it yourself. Check your link to make sure there is a "/" after the "blogger.com" part, and if it's missing, add it in. E.g.: http://www.blogger.comlotsofcrazytexthere would become http://www.blogger.com/lotsofcrazytexthere.

If that doesn't help, please be patient, and check back on this page for updates. Once we've fixed the problem, you can request a new password recovery email which will work.

Update (2pm PDT): This should now be fixed. If you are still having trouble getting your login information, please request a new password recovery email here.

Blogger will be down for maintenance tomorrow for 45 minutes starting at 4pm (Pacific Time).

Update: This has been reschedule to tomorrow (8/10) at 4pm.

We are having problems with one of the Blogger databases. Posts and commments to blogs that are stored on that database are failing. We are working on getting the database back up. Thanks for your patience.

Update (8:45a): this has been fixed.

Due to a configuration change made earlier this evening, around 10% of requests made to Blog*Spot will not be successfully returned. Users will see slowness when trying to access a blog on Blog*Spot and a server error will be returned.

If you see this problem, refreshing the page you are trying to access will typically resolve the problem. And we are working on a fix as well.

Update 11:24p: This has now been resolved.
Update 11:56p: To be more precise, it has been resolved but the change has to propagate which may take a little more time.

Some folks are finding that some of their emailed posts get dropped and don't reach their blogs. We're looking into this.

Update, 8/1: We found the problem in one of our mail servers, so new emailed posts should go through normally now. You might also start seeing old messages show up that previously hadn't gone through.
Some users are noticing problems with photo uploading timing out or taking a very long time to respond. We're looking into this and will post an update when there is more information.

We've been having some database issues this morning, causing Blogger.com to be inaccessible for some users. We're investigating the cause of the trouble, so thanks for bearing with us as we work on getting everything running normally again.

Update: For the majority of users things should be working properly again now, though there may still be a few smaller, lingering issues. We plan on having these resolved by the end of the day.

We need to perform hardware maintenance on the photos system for Blogger. This means that photo uploading and serving will be down for approximately 1 hour starting at 5pm (Pacific Time). All photos previously uploaded will not be visible during this maintenance.

Thanks for your understanding.

Update: This is now complete. Thanks for your patience.
Earlier today some users were experiencing trouble publishing their FTP blog. If you were seeing "0% complete" for long periods of time, please try publishing again.
Photo uploading and serving will be briefly unavailable for 5 minutes around 2p today. During this time photos will be unviewable as we perform hardware maintenance.

Tomorrow we will have an outage of 90 minutes from 4p to 4:30p 5:30p (Pacific Time) as we perform some hardware upgrades. At the beginning of this outage (the first five minutes), blogger.com will appear completely inaccessible. Following this, a status message will appear for the remainder of the 90 minute outage during which time users will be unable to update their blogs.

Update: The maintenance is now complete and took only 35 minutes. Blogger should be back to normal.

We're currently experiencing some problems with the help site and are working to restore access.

Update: The help site is working normally again. (11:45 AM)

We continue to upgrade hardware and make changes in response to last week's problems. Additionally, we are still investigating the photo uploading problem seen by some users. While this problem has been reported by a number of people, it is not consistently reproduceable - we're working with the folks who are running into this to gather as much information as possible about how it occurs.

Late last night we pushed new code and once again replaced harware in order to combat the problems of the past few days. As of this morning it appears to have improved the responsiveness of the site, altho' there are still fixes we want to make to get Blogger faster for everyone.

Also, we are working on fixing the problems some users are seeing with photo upload failures.

For many users, Blogger will have been extremely slow or down for most of the morning. We continue to work on fixes for this problem and hope to have it resolved as quickly as possible.

Update (4:45p): We are planning another infrastructure overhaul to address the significant problems we've been having in the past several days.

Update (6:59p): We've made another change that has improved performance, but we are also planning to make additional changes this evening.

Update (10:45a, June 9): The issues with the database servers have been resolved last night.

This morning, a hardware problem we had been struggling with over the past several days suddenly worsened. As a result, and to stave off future downtime, we have had to take Blogger down for an extended period of time as we address the problem. We will continue to update this blog and the homepage with more information.

Update: We've brought up new hardware which has allowed us to restore the site. We try hard to avoid downtimes of this length and apologize for the inconvenience.

Photo uploading will be disabled for 30 minutes this evening starting at 10pm (Pacific Time).

Update: This is taking longer than expected. Hopefully we will be done by 11:45pm (Pacific Time). We will update as we learn more.

Update: We are now finished. Thank you for your patience.

We are now recovering from an unscheduled downtime, related to the problem from last week.

There is still some residual slowness as a result of emergency maintenance we are performing on the system.

We are having intermittent downtime because of a hardware problem. We are working to resolve this issue.

Update: This has been resolved.

Some users will be seeing an error at login because of a change made last night. We are working on a fix for this problem now.

Update, 10AM Thursday: This was fixed at about 2PM yesterday afternoon.

From approximately 5:45pm to 6:30pm, some people may have had trouble accessing their blogs as a database job was causing queries to be slow. Things have been restored to normal. Sorry for the interruption.

Right now we’re having problems with blog publishing. Affected users will see the publish status page hang at 0% complete. Our engineers are investigating.

Update, 3:55: All seems to be back to normal. If you weren’t able to publish before, go to the “Status” subtab and republish. No posts were lost. Apologies to all of you who were affected, and to your readers as well.
A networking issue caused both Blogger and Blog*Spot to be sluggish and and partially unresponsive for a period of about 2 hours this morning. We are now recovered from this outage.

Currently some users are getting “No route to host” errors when publishing to Blog*Spot. We’re looking into this. In the mean time, logging out and clearing cookies should relieve the problem.

Update, 6:45PM: All sorted out. Apologies to those folks who were affected by this during the afternoon.

Blogger.com will be down on April 24 2006 from 4 pm PDT to 4:45 pm PDT due to planned maintenance. We’re sorry about the one-two unplanned/planned outage punch today, but we need to do some database maintenance. You will still be able to view your blogs during the outage. Be assured that when Blogger.com comes back, it will be shinier and happier than ever.

Update: The maintenance is complete. Blogger is back to normal.

All publishing is broken right now. We’re working on fixing it.

Update, 10:15AM: We have Blog*Spot publishing working again. External publishing coming soon.

Update, 10:41AM: External publishing is working again as well. Plus users, we haven't forgotten about you.

Update, 10:50AM: Everything sorted out now and working fine. Expect possible transient slownesses as we shore up some of the quick fixes that we had to make.

One of our databases is down, which prevents users from publishing to certain blogs. We are working on getting the database back.

Update: the database was repaired early this morning PST.

Blogger will be down on April 19 2006 from 4 pm PST to 4:45 pm PST due to planned maintenance. We regret any inconvenience caused to our users. You will still be able to view your blogs.

(Correction: Whoops! Technically, we meant “PDT,” not “PST.” Daylight saving and all that. Hope we didn’t throw anyone.)

At 11:30 this morning, we experienced a system failure in one of our databases and some people were unable to create new entries on their blog during that time. As of now that database is back online and those users are again able to create new entries on their blog.



We are investigating what failed and will take measures to make sure it doesn't happen again.
Blogger was slower than normal this morning due to database issues. We performed some quick maintenance and things should be back to normal now.

Blogger will be down today from 5 pm PST for 45 minutes. We regret any inconvenience caused to our users. You will still be able to view your blogs.

Update: The maintenance was successful. Blogger is back to normal.
Some users will be unable to view or publish their blogs for half an hour between 4 pm and 4:30 pm PST. We have to do some maintenance one of our filers. Sorry for the inconvenience.

Some users are experiencing problems creating new posts via our Atom API. We are working to get this fixed. In the meantime, you can create new posts via the web interface.


Update 4:30pm This is now fixed. Sorry for the trouble.

We’re experiencing some intermittent slowness in our photo uploading infrastructure. If you’re patient, your photo may get uploaded before your browser times out. Folks are investigating and fixing.

Update, 9:15: This has been fixed.

Some of you may be seeing the “Blogger Problem” error page when you visit Blogger.com. If you see this, clearing your blogger.com cookies and trying again will resolve it (might take a few tries, though). Some of the servers are misbehaving, but we’re getting it all back in line now.

Update, 5:25: All sorted out.

We've finally finished moving all the affected blogs off of the bad machine that has been causing us so much trouble recently. You may see some lingering problems with a few blogs that were incorrectly or incompletely published on their last update, but republishing any such blogs should fix them. If you continue to receive errors viewing any blogs, try clearing your browser's cache and then refreshing the page. Going forward, though, things should be back to working normally. Thanks for sticking with us through this.

A clarification about the filer we restored yesterday: This machine is indeed up and functioning again, so the affected blogs are no longer entirely inaccessible. However, it is still not in great shape and we are in the process of moving all the data off of it and on to better machines. So over the next few days there may still be lingering and intermittent problems for some blogs. This includes the "forbidden" errors we're all getting tired of, as well as occasional publishing errors, or incompletely published pages. If you get an error viewing a blog, refreshing the page once or twice should clear it. For publishing problems, simply wait a few minutes and republish, and that should take care of it. Thanks for your patience while we work on clearing all this up.

The filer that we have been having trouble with in the last few days failed again. Those blogs that are stored on the bad filer are temporarily not available for publishing and viewing. We are working on replacing the filer and restoring access to the blogs affected.

Update (10:40 am, March 17): The filer has been restored. All affected blogs are available for publishing and reading.

Currently photo uploading is not working for FTP users. We are aware of the problem and should have a fix within a few hours. We apologize for the inconvenience.


Update (4:10pm) : This has been fixed. Thank you for your patience.

Unfortunately, we have to do some maintenance on one of our filers today from 9 am to 9:40 am PST. Some blogs will be inaccessible while this is going on. Everyone is able to publish, however, regardless of whether or not the blog is down for maintenance.

We apologize to those blog owners who are affected by this.

Update: This maintenance is now complete.

We’re doing some maintenance on one of our Blog*Spot servers. Some blogs will be inaccessible while this is going on. Everyone is able to publish, however, regardless of whether or not the blog is down for maintenance.

We apologize to those blog owners who are affected by this. This partial outage is necessary to fix some of the transient Blog*Spot problems that have popped up recently.

Update: The maintenance is complete.

Some users are currently getting “403 Forbidden” errors when viewing their blogs, and “Permission Denied” errors (or variations thereof) when publishing. You may recognize this problem from Monday.

The offending server is being replaced and then shot. We’ll let you know when things are back up. Shouldn’t be too long.

Until then, affected blogs will be unavailable and unpublishtoable.

Update, 5 minutes later: All fixed!

Some users are currently getting "403 Forbidden" errors when viewing their blogs, and "Permission Denied" errors (or variations thereof) when publishing. We're restarting some machines right now and things should be working again very soon.

Update: This has now been fixed. If you still encounter problems, please clear your browser's cache and cookies, then give it another shot.

We’re experiencing some problems with one of our databases. Some posts may not be saved, and other, saved posts, may not be visible in the app. Working on fixing this now…

Update, 12:44PM: This has been sorted out. We’re continuing to investigate the root cause and why our monitoring didn’t catch it sooner, but Blogger is back to functioning normally. Posts made from now on will be saved.

I’m very sorry to say that, if your blog was on this database, posts and template changes made in the last 18 hours or so were not saved. They may appear on your blog now, but will disappear if you republish. If you made a post between Friday afternoon and now, we suggest that you look at your list of posts (“Posting” tab, “Edit posts” sub-tab) and compare it with what is published on your blog. If posts are missing, copy them from your blog pages before you republish.

Major apologies to those of you who were affected. We work hard to maintain Blogger as a trustworthy place to keep your writing, and we really hate to let you down.

A small number of users are seeing a 553 Permission denied error when publishing to Blog*Spot. If this happens to you, logout of Blogger, clear your blogger.com cookies, and log back in. We are working to fix this problem.

Update, 2/21: This is now fixed.

Sorry for the short notice. Blogger.com will be down tonight, Thursday, February 9th, from 9:00–10:00PM PST. Blog*Spot will be unaffected.

We’re upgrading a database, which gives us more room to grow and will fix some transient comment problems that some of you have had recently.

The domain association problem mentioned yesterday has now been resolved. If you are still experiencing a problem with your mapped domain, please let Support know.

A reminder that we will also be down for planned maintenance starting at 7p (PST) this evening. We will be using this time to replace the older hardware responsible for many of the problems we experienced last week.

Just a quick reminder that we will be going ahead with a planned network maintenance on Monday the 6th from 7–8PM PST. Blogger and Blog*Spot blogs will be unavailable during that time.

This maintenance won’t fix everything, but it will make things better. I promise.

As many people will have noticed, we've had significant hardware trouble over the past couple days. We have tried to keep all of you informed about the status of the service and our efforts to correct the problems. Unfortunately, today's problems were widespread enough such that we were unable to provide ongoing updates. One of the things we'll be doing in the short term is to come up with ways to prevent this.

Eric details the chronology below. There is one residual issue related to the outage: some legacy users have domain associations between Blog*Spot and external domains. These associations are not functional at this time.

In addition to working on this problem, we'll also be making the necessary changes to guard against the outages we experienced over the past 48 hours.

We will provide updates on our progress as changes are made. I sincerely apologize for the downtime - in the past six months I feel we've made significant strides to limit this type of failure. We obviously have more work to do and carrying it out will be our highest priority.

Blogspot is again experiencing problems - we are investigating.

Update, 8PM: We have restored all of Blog*Spot, save one of our filers. This means that some blogs will still be unpublishable and inaccessible. Our engineers are continuing to work on this problem.

Update, 11PM: Blog*Spot servers are restarting now and connecting with the filer. All blogs should be publishable and accessible within the next 20–30 minutes.

[So how has everyone else’s weekend been? —Pete]

We are currently experiencing some problems with Blog*Spot. A percentage of blogs are completely inaccessible. For others, you may need to reload a few times before you connect to a web server that will serve them. We anticipate things will be calmed down within the hour.

Update, 5:20PM: Blogger and Blog*Spot should be fully operational with the exception of one of our file servers. This means a percentage of blogs will be unpublishable and inaccessible. We are currently waiting for a lengthy disk integrity check to complete on the file server. There may also be transient delays serving blog pages while our load balancing evens out.

Update, 8:00PM: The Blog*Spot web servers are coming back online with connections to the file server that was out for most of the evening. (Its disk is totally okay, btw.) So, within the next 10–15 minutes everything should be completely back to normal.

Again, super major apologies for this.

Blogger.com is back working again, again. Unscheduled outage hat trick tonight. As I get more information from our worldwide operations team I’ll let you know a bit more of why Blogger.com went down, and what we’ve done to keep this particular problem at bay.

Blogger.com is now back from a 45 minute outage. Two outages in one night. I feel like Dante from Clerks: “I’m not even supposed to be carrying the pager today!”

We’re really sorry about this spate of random downtime. As Jason mentioned, I mentioned that Monday’s fixup will lessen these types of outages in the future. The Blogger and Google engineers and ops folks are not just sitting around waiting for the next failure; we’re actively improving our infrastructure to lessen both the planned and unplanned Blogger outages.

We're recovering now from a unscheduled outage of about 20 minutes. As Pete mentions below, we are almost finished migrating from some unreliable hardware. This should help to prevent downtimes like this.

Okay, big lead time on this one. Lots of time to prepare yourself.

Blogger and Blog*Spot will be offline for approximately one hour from 7–8PM this coming Monday, February 6th. The little outage indicator will kick in Sunday night to remind you.

This time, we’re completing the long–prepared for cutover from an older, flakier piece of network equiptment to a shiny bright new one. (This is how they explain things to software guys like me.) That means fewer planned and “unplanned” outages in the future. Seriously. I wouldn’t be too surprised if the ops guys get all Office Space on the thing they’re taking out, given the trouble it’s caused.

Now get thee back to blogging.
We're now recovering from a 15 minute outage. Apologies for the unscheduled downtime.

We'll be taking Blogger down on Wednesday the 25th at 4pm PST to fix a bit of a switch that's gone wonky on us. The outage should last about 15 minutes. Blogger.com and Blog*Spot blogs will be inaccessible during this time.

This repair will fix the problem that caused the brief outage last Friday night. We're also using this down time as an opportunity to tune our databases for more efficient spam catching and deletion.

Update:
Theres a notice saying "scheduled outage at 4:00 PST" on blogger. I spent the whole time of writing this trying to figure out what they might do to cause a scheduled outrage before I noticed the lack of an r.
Found on McBlog

(P.S.: The switch and the rest of Blogger is cheerful and productive.)

Over the weekend, some users were seeing generic "unexpected error" messages when attempting to log in to their accounts. That problem has been patched as of about 10 AM this morning (PST), so if you were affected by it your account should be working normally again now. If you still see the error, just clear your browser's cookies, then log in again.

At 6am, some Blogger users suffered a 10-minute outage while a database took a nap. We apologize for the inconvenience while we continue to improve our service.

Update: After some early morning investigation, we further pinned down and isolated the issue. We will be taking steps this week to ensure this particular problem does not occur again.

Blogger will be down for ~10 minutes this afternoon at 3:30pm PST, for some network maintenance.

Update: This outage has been cancelled.

Some users are seeing "No space left on device" when attempting to publish. We're looking into this error and hope to have it resolved shortly.

Status: This has been resolved.
Information about yesterday’s Blog*Spot outage posted to Blogger Buzz.

We are planning a two hour outage this evening from 9p to 11p (PST). This is to complete the network maintenance we've been performing over the last several weeks.

Update: this has been postponed and will not happen tonight.

One of the Blogger databases is down that causes some blogs to be unaccessible and general slowness on the site. We are working on resolving the problem and apologize for the inconvenience.

Update: This has been resolved.

We will be upgrading our network access this weekend which will require downtime for both Blogger and Blog*Spot. The outage will occur at noon (Pacific Time) on Saturday and last for 2 hours. Thanks for your patience during this maintenance window.

There are problems currently with photo uploading. We are working on fixing it.

Update: This is fixed now.
Over the weekend there were some errors with our help request form that caused some people to be unable to submit their questions and problems to Blogger Support. This is now fixed.

We have decided to go ahead with the network maintenance. Blogger will be down from 5 pm to 7 pm as planned.

Update: Blogger is back up now. The outage lasted 40 minutes longer than expected because of a bad network device.

Blogger will be down tomorrow (Wednesday, October 5th) from 5-7pm PST for some network maintenance.

Update: This has been postponed until next week; details will be posted here.

Blogger will be down for a database upgrade tomorrow (Thursday, September 29th) at 4:30pm PST, for about an hour. As usual, we'll post more info here if it ends up taking longer than that.

Update: this is complete.

The image upload feature is currently failing on some of our servers. If this is affecting you, please try clearing your browser's cache and cookies, and then signing in again. This should put you on a different server, which may work better. We are working on getting this fixed and we will update this post when everything is back to normal.

Update: This issue has been fixed.

There'll be a brief (~15 mins) outage at 4pm PST today so we can upgrade the memory in one of Blogger's servers. Details will be posted here if it looks like it'll take longer than expected.

Update: This is complete.

Blogger is suffering some problems due to a server outage leading to errors on Blogger as well as blogspot. We are trying to rapidly fix this problem and Blogger should be back up soon.

Update: 9/21 12:02: This is fixed now.

From 9:30 to 10am we suffered an outage on one of our databases. This resulted in some people being unable to login to their accounts or post to their blogs. We're sorry for the inconvenience and are investigating what further measures to take.

Tomorrow (Sep9), there will be a scheduled outage (~1 hour) at 3pm while we move some stuff from older servers to newer ones. We'll post more info here if it takes longer.

Update: This is complete.
We had a 30-minute outage from 6 am to 6:30 while one of our databases had a problem. Service is back up and we are investigating how to prevent this in the future.
We had a 50 minute outage from midnight to 12:50 a.m. due to problems with a database. The machine has been restored and Blogger is back to normal.

The WYSIWYG post editor buttons are not currently appearing for some people using Blogger in various languages.
