We've verified this for French, Italian, and UK English, but it may affect others as well. If this is affecting you, please change your settings back to English for now and that should work. You can do this by clicking the "language" link at the very bottom of your dashboard (or by clicking here) and then selecting the first "English" option (but not "English (UK)"). We are working right now on getting these features back and working again for all languages.

Update: This should now be fixed. Feel free to change back to your preferred language setting, following the link above. If you continue to see problems with the posting form, please clear your browser's cache and cookies, then login again.
We've just recovered from a 40 minute outage caused by a machine problem in the production network. We apologize for the unannounced downtime.
We will have a brief (hopefully 5 minute) outage on blogger.com as we replace a faulty switch.
We will have a downtime of one hour tomorrow at 6pm Pacific Time. Apologies for the extended maintenance - we're using this opportunity to perform a major database upgrade.

As noted on some blogs, our Developer's Network blog was overwritten with another blog late last night.

This was not the result of a hack attempt but of a subtle bug that occured because our Developer's Network blog is a special case. This bug could not have affected regular user's blogs hosted on Blogspot.com.

We have corrected the issue and apologize if it caused you alarm.
One of our databases was having trouble this morning (8 - 8:45 am), affecting some of our users.
Blogger was down briefly this morning due to a networking bug; please try republishing your blog if it wasn't publishing earlier.
Image-uploading was briefly down due to a bug, which has now been fixed.

BlogSend emails going to aol.com addresses are currently bouncing; we've already contacted AOL, and this should be resolved soon.

Update: this has been fixed.

Update: There's a fix posted over at Blogger Buzz. (There is now a setting to turn off the code and it's explained over at Buzz.)

The launch of Blogger Images required a bit of new code that is causing some users annoying layout problems. Before launch, the templates passed our tests but because of the open nature of Blogger templates, we weren't sure which kinds of template modifications were going to be affected. We're hammering out the solution now and we'll update our help site with some workarounds today.

Some users are currently experiencing trouble with Blogger 1.0 API calls. A fix should be ready soon.

Update: this has been fixed.

We've tracked down the bug causing the feed description length problems, and it'll be fixed within the next hour.

Thanks for your patience.

Update: if you were affected by this bug, simply click Republish Index Only in the Posting | Status tab in Blogger.

Due to a hardware error, a percentage of Blog*Spot users will run into intermittent trouble when trying to access their blogs. We have people in the datacenter working on the problem and anticipate that this will be corrected during the next two hours.
There will be a 20 minute downtime tomorrow at 4pm (Pacific Time) as we update monitoring on the database servers.

We will also be down for about 10 minutes right now to reboot some servers.

Update: That actually was more like 20 minutes, but we're back up and running now. This afternoon's maintenance is still on schedule for 2 pm. Thanks for your patience.

There will be scheduled downtime for 45 minutes at 2 PM PST today to replace the faulty piece of network equipment that caused problems this morning. We apologize for the short notice and the inconvenience.

A faulty piece of network equipment is affecting some of our users since 5:30 am PST. We are actively working to repair/replace it.

This has now been fixed.
We will have 1 hour of scheduled downtime on Tuesday, May 10th at 4pm (Pacific Time), to do some database maintenance.

Due to a piece of faulty equipment, we are having networking problems in the Blogger datacenter. This has impacted site speed and reliability. Techs have been sent to replace the bad hardware.

Update (from Steve): Our field techs took care of this and Blogger is back to normal.
Blogger had an unexpected outage of 20 minutes between 11:15a and 11:35a (Pacific Time). We apologize for the unanounced downtime.

Some BlogSpot blogs are occasionally getting redirected to the Blogger.com homepage right now. Since this problem is sporadic, you should be able to simply load the BlogSpot address again and have it work normally. If not, try clearing your browser's cache and cookies first, and then reloading it. We'll get this fixed as soon as possible.

Update: This has now been fixed.
We will have a 20 minute downtime on Thursday at 4pm (Pacific Time) as we upgrade a database server.

We're still seeing some user reports of "Internal Server Errors" when trying to access Blogger. The incident of these errors has been decreasing in the past 2 weeks and we're continuing to address this problem.

Update: We have resolved this issue.
We just had a 3 minute outage on blogger.com due to a networking problem. I apologize for the unannounced downtime.
Some users are currently encountering Internal Server Errors when trying to use Blogger. We are looking into this problem.

Currently, SSL connections to Blogger.com are being refused. We are investigating and will update this post when we have further information.

Update: This has been taken care of. Thank you for your patience.

Update: That help page is working now.

This would be funny if it weren't frustrating some users. We've discovered a problem with the page people use to report problems. Just letting you know that we're fixing it now and if you plan on writing support, please take note:

On step #2, "Which blog does it affect?" you must choose a blog or the form won't work. If that doesn't work, email support and be sure to include the following information:
  • Brief, but descriptive subject
  • Description of the problem
  • Username (not your password)
  • Your blog address (URL)
Again, we have a fix for this and it's being deployed now.
If you are experiencing problems loading Blogger.com, please try clearing the cookies in your browser.

This afternoon we pushed into production a number of performance enhancements which have improved the responsiveness of the site. Additionally, we have eliminated an automated spam problem which was negatively impacting publish success rates.

Tomorrow we will have a 15 minute outage at noon (Pacific Time) as we reconfigure some portions of the Blogger network.

Some users may be experiencing an unexpected Blogger outage right now; we're looking into it and will post updated info soon. Thanks for your patience.

Update: this has been fixed.

Some BlogSpot blogs are currently receiving error messages that say "EOF while reading from control connection" when publishing. This varies according to which of our servers you are on at the time, so if you are having this problem, please try logging out of Blogger and then logging in again to publish, which should put you on a new server automatically. We are currently investigating the source of this problem.

Update: This should now be fixed.

We've had to rollback to an earlier build this morning in order to fix some outstanding publishing bugs. This has had stability implications which we are now in the process of addressing.

Update: These problems have now subsided. We are in the process of preparing a new build which will include an additional performance enhancement as well as a fix for BlogThis.

We're currently in the process of rolling back a bad kernel upgrade that has significantly impacted the service. Restored app servers are coming back online and all should be repaired by the end of today.

Update: The rollback has been completed and performance is starting to stabilize across the appservers.

There will be a 90 minute outage on Blogger tomorrow night at 10pm (PST). During this outage we will be addressing power management in the Blogger cluster, thus allowing us to substantively increase the number of machines serving the site.

Thanks for your patience during this downtime - the upgrade will allow us to make continued improvements to the service's stability and performance.

Over the weekend, we've made some additional changes which have helped performance. We've addded more machines to the cage and rewritten some portions of the code which were overutilizing system resources.

There's still more to do and we'll be making more changes this week (hardware and software) to further improve Blogger's responsiveness.

Yesterday, we increased the server capacity of blogger.com by 20% in order to address some of the stability problems we are seeing. This has had a positive impact but there is more to do.

What we are seeing is that individual application servers will trend toward 100% CPU usage over time - simply, the appservers get pegged and users on those servers encounter paralyzingly slow load times throughout the site. Over the course of the next week, we will be doubling the number of machines responsible for serving blogger.com in order to address this.

Users with more than 500 posts are also being severely hampered at this time. We believe this is due to an improper use of system resources when users of such blogs either access the Edit Posts page or attempt to publish. We will be testing a potential fix to this problem over the next couple days and hope to push it to production early next week. Because of the extent of the change, we need to fully assess the impact on the service before deployment.

This blog will be updated with additional news on these solutions to the current problems.

Feed URL Update

In case you read this blog in a newsreader, please update your subscriptions to point to this new location: http://status.blogger.com/atom.xml

In the past several days, we've had a bout of stability problems with Blogger. Yesterday morning, users were encountering errors when trying to login and access their blogs.

During this time, mail-to-blogger was temporarily disabled in an attempt to resolve some of the difficulties - it is once again back on, altho' message processing may be delayed. Additionally, we are working on a patch to fix a bug that has prevented many users from leaving comments today.

Most of these problems were caused by an increased amount of load on the blogger.com application servers. We have addressed this problem by increasing the number of machines that serve the site. However, there is more work to do. In addition to bringing on more machines and completing additional capacity planning, we are also working to identify and correct problematic database queries. These queries are poorly optimized and lead to the increased load that jeopardized the service in the past few days.

As a Blogger user, I completely understand how unacceptable the performance has been in the past few days and it is the focus of the engineering team to fix these issues.

Some users are currently receiving "no mail alias" errors when they attempt to post to their blogs via email. We are working on getting this resolved, but if this affects you then what you can do in the meantime is to try changing the "secret word" part of your Mail-to-Blogger settings, which may help. We will post an update here once we get the problem fixed.

In the past several days, we've seen some performance problems with Blogger. In general, the app has been slower and users have encountered an increased number of Internal Server Errors.

We are aggressively fixing the source of the errors and have pushed several fixes in the past few days to address the problem. There is additional work to do to return Blogger back to a more responsive state - and we're on it. If you find yourself seeing errors, please logout of Blogger and completely shutdown your browser. When you restart your browser and log back in, you will be on a new appserver which may be less loaded and thus performing better.

Thanks for hanging in there as we straighten out this issue.

There will be a one hour downtime tomorrow at 5pm (Pacific Time) as we update a database server. Because all databases are not affected, the site will remain up and most users will continue to have access to blogger.com. However, certain users will receive errors when accessing their blogs during this time.

We're having problems with the timely processing of posts on Mail-to-Blogger.

We're working to fix this now.

As a result of new code pushed last week, a couple of bugs have been introduced which affect a small number of users.
  • some will get an error page when clicking on the name of their blog from the Dashboard
  • those with long usernames will be unable to log in
We are working on fixes for both problems now.
We will have a 15 minute outage on Blog*Spot on Friday at 11a (Pacific Time).
We need to have a 15 minute downtime at 6:45p (Pacific Time) in order to update a problematic router. I apologize for the short notice.
Mail-to-Blogger is currently slow to post content sent via email. We are working to improve the performance of this system.
There will be a brief 15 minute outage on Thursday at 3pm (Pacific Time) as we upgrade some routers in our cage.
Mail2Blogger has been experiencing some stability issues for the past few days, and our Ops folks are checking to see what's happening. We'll update this post when we know more about what's going on.

A misconfigured router is causing the current mail2blogger, ftp and sftp publishing problems. Our Ops folks are working on it and it will be fixed soon.

Update, 10:30am: this has been fixed.

I wanted to give an update on our progress in dealing with the database performance problems. We have recently deployed a new set of servers to help shoulder the increased load - these servers are significantly better hardware (more memory). As a result, they'll help increase responsiveness throughout the app.

We've also identified a specific set of queries responsible for the database freezes we've seen. By re-writing these queries, we've been able to get to the heart of the most serious problems we've been facing. We now believe that the databases are signficantly less likely to freeze.

We have additional work to do. For example, users with larger blogs are still seeing unacceptably slow load times when accessing their blogs from the dashboard. There are other improvements we will be making as well as a completely replacement of our current infrastructure in favor of a more robust datastore. However, we're optimistic that the situation has improved.
We will be having a 15 minute downtime tomorrow at 3pm (Pacific Time) in order to make network changes.

Sorry for the late notice, but Blogger will be down for about 15 minutes starting at 1:30pm (Pacific Time).

Update: This has been completed.

We've had to restart the databases multiple times today because of server freezes. During the freezes, users would have encountered error pages when trying to access their blogs.

We're planning on a number of improvements this week to address this very serious situation. First, we will be pushing new code to both gather information on these freezes as well as revise some features to put less strain on the database. Second, we will be effectively doubling the number of machines used to handle the db workload.

I will update status with additional information our progress toward these goals.

Blogger will be down for 1 hour tomorrow at 3pm (Pacific Time) so that we may perform network maintenance.

Thanks for your understanding.

Update: This is now complete.

We've sadly had another round of database trouble today and apologize to those who received errors when trying to access their blogs. We're continuing to dive into the cause of these problems while simultaneously engineering a complete replacement of the backend datastore.

We're putting all of our efforts into this issue - I know how frustrating these outages are because, as a users ourselves, they affect us as well.

We've temporarily disabled stats collection as seen in the post counts on the dashboard and on the user profile pages. We plan to restore this functionality in the short term but have needed to stop collecting the information for now in order to stabilize the database servers.

We're once again having trouble with a database server today and have had to restart it multiple times. We've determined that there are a number of queries running on this server which are adversely impacting performance. We're now engineering alternate ways of dealing with this data and will deploy new code ASAP.

Update: We've pushed out new code which should help with the database trouble we've been having.

We had another significant problem with a database server last night that would have resulted in a large number of errors and problems with accessing posts. We are working to migrate data off of this troubled server and replace it with better hardware.
One of the database servers was having performance trouble for several hours this morning starting at about 5am PST. This has slowed down the site overall and we're working to address this problem.
Mail-to-Blogger is currently having some problems; many users are unable to post through email. We are working to fix the trouble now.

Blogger will be unavailable this afternoon so that we can perform network maintenance at 2pm (Pacific Time). As noted by Biz, we have a number of changes planned to improve the performance of the system - not all of them will require downtime. In today's case, we will be making the first of several planned network upgrades to improve the speed between our various servers.

Update: This has been completed.

I don't usually post here at status but I just wanted to drop by and say: Damn, Blogger is slow. We've been growing for years, but our relaunch last May blew the doors off all the numbers we had come to expect. Blogger activity is through the roof every day and increasing. As a team, we're elated, but as an individual user, I feel your pain.

We're fixing it right now. In addition to buying and installing a supernatural amount of brand new machines, and upgrading existing hardware, we're moving away from the last of some third-party solutions that have given us trouble. Blogger will be on an impressively scalable custom Google architecture which translates into much more than just speed. It means improvements, enhancements, and integration.

Thank you for being patient, we know slow sucks. Wires, boxes, machines, and all manner of gadgetry are being installed at this very moment. We're 100% focused on speeding Blogger up to the point where I am not personally averse to mandating everyone at Blogger dress up as The Flash for Halloween. We are making Blogger faster for you. After all, one of our users is The Incredible Hulk. We wouldn't like him when he's angry.

One of our database servers was in an inaccessible state for about 2 hours this morning. As a result, users on that server would have been unable to access their blogs. This problem has now been resolved and we will be moving away from this type of storage solution.

Starting around midnight last night, we have had significant network
problems that would have prevented some Blogger users from accessing
the site. We continue to work on the problem and will update this
blog with additional information.

Update: A major error was made in the network routing from the Blogger datacenter. This affected certain users from specific routes trying to request pages from Blogger or Blog*Spot. This change has been reverted and we're following up to make sure this kind of problem does not re-occur.

Recently we have had some trouble with a load balancer that governs the transport of files to blogspot.com. We will have a 20 minute downtime tomorrow afternoon at 1:30pm (Pacific Time) to update the firmware on this loadbalancer.

Update: This has been postponed until Wednesday 10/20 at 6pm.

In the past few days, publishing to external hosts with Blogger has been unreliable. Users have seen numerous "connection refused errors". We are looking into these problems with the FTP out functionality.

Since Friday, we've had a couple appservers that are not allowing logins. As a result you may have been unable to access your accounts. We're going to be fixing this shortly - in the meantime, if you encounter this problem, close and restart your browser. This will let you connect to a new server, hopefully resolving the problem.
We will be upgrading a switch in the Blogger cage tomorrow that will necessitate about 15 minutes of downtime starting at 5:30pm (Pacific Time).

Publishing to Blog*Spot is currently not working. This problem has affected the overall stability of Blogger and is causing non-responsiveness when accessing blogs from the Dashboard. We are working to fix the problem.

Update: Publishing to Blog*Spot is back online. We had a simultaneous failure across multiple machines responsible for the publishing of Blog*Spot blogs. To prevent this type of outage in the future, we are performing a full system audit to ensure that proper redundancies are in place.

As of last week's build, we've introduced a bug such that the link to a post in an atom feed is now to the archive page rather than the post page. We should have a fix for this shortly.

Update: This has been fixed.

We will be restarting one of the production databases this afternoon at 5:25pm (Pacific Time). This will result in approximately 10 minutes of downtime.

Update: The restart has taken a bit longer than anticipated. Some users will be seeing error messages when attempting to access their blogs. I apologize for this - we're working to restore access.

We've made some machine changes to handle the additional mail load and there should be a performance improvement for all features relying on mail out.

We've also pushed a new build which fixes a problem with BlogThis! such that HTML escaping would be performed incorrectly.

There is a problem with comment deletion for non-admins and we are working on a fix - comments will be deleted in the meantime but will still appear until the blog is republished.

We've had some trouble in the last few days with email. Specifically, emails aren't being sent out reliably which impacts features such as BlogSend, comment notification, team invites and username/password recovery. We're bringing additional machines online to handle the load here and have started catching up with the backlog. Sorry for the late- or non-delivery of messages sent by Blogger.
Blogger will be unavailable for about 10 minutes this afternoon starting at 6pm (Pacific Time). This is the second part of a network upgrade which began last week.

We are in the process of pushing new code that will address some display problems with the newly released navbar.

Additionally, we will be having approximately 15 minutes of downtime this afternoon at 4pm (Pacific Time) in order to upgrade a central switch in our cage. As network traffic has increased significantly over the past several months, we will be upgrading to a higher throughput switch. Sorry for the short notice, but the outage should be brief.
Changes pushed today broke BloggerAPI 2.0 - we're in the process of working out a fix.

Blogger had about 5 minutes of downtime just now as we updated the databases. Sorry for the unannounced downtime - we're working on a way to perform these types of updates without impacting the service.

bStats is currently unavailable and we're working to bring it back up. bStats has proven to be very difficult to support even for the small subset of users who were granted access. We are looking at sunsetting this service and will be posting additional information in the days ahead.

Some users have reported seeing their Blog*Spot blogs redirect to sparclinux.org. This is because of a problem with some third-party comment code.

If you see this problem, you will need to edit your templates to remove the BlogSpeak commenting system being hosted by sparclinux.

You can modify your template to use Blogger comments by using the tags described here.

Bonanza! We've just pushed a veritable ton of improvements to the WYSIWYG editor and a new feature to boot.

New stuff first: if you're a fan of always using Edit HTML mode (or are using a browser that doesn't support Compose mode well) you can now hide Compose mode from Settings | Basic. If you leave Compose mode on, we'll still remember which mode you last used to create a post.

Now for the fixes:
  • details on publish failures are viewable once again
  • tabbing from title/url field to post field has been fixed
  • no extraneous spaces will appear in the post field when switching modes
  • uploading images will work in Safari once again
  • keyboard shortcuts have been fixed in IE6
  • closing div tags will no longer change location upon switching modes
  • further refinements have been made to better handle the escaping of html entities

Mail-to-blogger is currently returning XML-RPC problems. This may be related to some of the recent network reconfigurations and we'll be working to figure out the problem.

Update: This has been resolved.

Because of a snafu at our ISP, blogger.com and blogspot.com were unavailable for about an hour this morning. As noted previously, we're working to make changes to the network configuration so as to retire an unneeded part of our network. Following the downtime, these changes should have been unnoticed, however, a misconfiguration resulted in a route loop and the unintentional downtime.

We are nearly finished migrating over from the old network and the rest of the transition should hopefully be smooth.

WYSIWYG improvements. We're pushing additional changes to the new editor based on the helpful feedback we've gotten from all of you. Addressed in this release:
  • no longer insert superfluous  's on newlines
  • fix the problem by which FireFox/Moz appear not to publish
  • restore preview for the Opera browser
  • fix the problem in FireFox/Moz whereby Compose mode couldn't be used after Preview
  • no longer escape the &'s in HTML entities
Also, we have additional changes in the works for the known issues we are tracking. Thanks for helping us improve the product.

We've just pushed another update to the WYSIWYG editor. This will increase the stability of the new post editor under Mozilla/Firefox on the PC. Previously, longer posts would tend to crash those browsers in Compose mode.

As an additional note, we're completely committed to resolving the cross-browser issues with this new feature. Most of us here use something other than the latest version of IE and we want to make sure that everyone can take advantage of the enhanced editor. Thanks for letting us know about the problems you encounter and for your patience as we fix them.

WYSIWYG Editor updates! We've pushed some new code to address some bugs in the initial release of the new editor. Specifically, we've fixed a problem whereby Safari would sometimes crash or otherwise not display posts correctly. And we will now remember which mode you last used to compose your post.

That means if you prefer to always write HTML, we will start you up in Edit HTML mode when you write a new post providing that your last post was published in that mode.

Edit HTML mode should be used by those who like to code their own posts including those who insert their own line breaks or use HTML-rich post templates.

We're still working on the Firefox problem whereby the publishing progress indicator never progresses (despite successful publishing). If you run into a bug, please let us know by sending a ticket to Support.

We've just pushed a version of Blogger that includes a new, feature-rich editor. You can find out more about it by checking out this knowledge base article.

If you are using Firefox/Mozilla and don't see the the new editor, refresh your browser on the compose post view. Also, in Firefox/Mozilla you may need to tell the built-in pop-up blocker to unblock blogger.com if you are unable to load the spellcheck or upload file dialogs.

Update: There was a bug in the initial release that would crash the latest version of Firefox when switching between compose modes. This bug has been fixed and we are in the process of pushing out the new code.

We are still looking at at the issue whereby Firefox will successfully publish, but never advance the progress indicator.

Publishing to Blog*Spot is currently not working because of a downed load-balancer. When we had previous problems with publishing to Blog*Spot, we added additional servers behind a load-balancer. Right now, that load-balancer is having trouble. This problem only started recently - in the last 20 minutes - and shouldn't take long to resolve.

Update: This has been fixed.

Because of the maintenance last night, mail-to-blogger is currently unavailable. The machines that power that feature did not successfully make the jump to the new domain controller. We'll be bringing them home soon.

As noted on the blogger.com news blog, we will be down for scheduled maintenance for 2 hours this evening from 8-10pm (Pacific Time).

A lot of the trouble we've had in the past couple weeks has been due to old system architecture problems. The way in which the network was configured last year is no longer appropriate for our growing service. So we're making the changes needed to make Blogger more stable and scalable.

This maintenance window will be used to change the way in which our database machines are configured to access the network. Previously, we've been using two different networks within the Blogger system and we'll be retiring the older, unneeded network.

In a separate downtime, we will be replacing a key database server that has been responsible for a lot of the recent trouble. News of the scheduled downtime will be posted on the blogger.com news blog and cross-posted here.

We resolved the issues with Blog*Spot late yesterday; we were especially unlucky in having numerous machines exhibit a similar problem at the same time. We will be implementing additional monitoring to give us early warning should this condition arise again as well as making longer-term infrastructure changes to prevent it from occuring.

The sluggishness with Blogger has also been addressed by tending to a particularly addled database server. Here we are also putting in place new monitoring to watch for this type of problem and making changes to prevent the machines from becoming similarly overloaded.
Blog*Spot will occassionally return a "not found" page when attempting to load a blog. We are working to determine the underlying cause.

An update to yesteday's note about unresponsiveness: The application servers are overloading because of an I/O problem. We will be pushing new code as soon as possible to address this. In the meantime, there will be some slowness and incidents of pages simply not loading. I apologize for the poor performance of the app today - we hope to have the problem corrected soon.
One of our machines is having intermittent problems resulting in some slowness and unexpected errors. We're working to correct the situation.

Internal server errors are being intermittently returned on blogger.com - we believe this is a load balancing problem and are working to correct the problem.

Update: This was a transient problem that has been resolved.

Some Blog*Spot blogs aren't being served — we're looking into the problem.

Update: this has been fixed.

The Forgot your Password? form is not functional at the moment—we're working on it.

Update: This has been fixed.

Blog*Spot Plus users are currently unable to update their blogs. We're working on the problem.

Update: This has been fixed.

bStats is currently unreachable; we're looking into the problem.

Update: bStats is back online.

Currently, the blogger application is not successfully sending mail. This will affect team invites, BlogSend and comment notification. The problem is being worked on.

Update: This has been fixed.

As we update mail-to-blogger to make it more robust, you may experience delays in posting via this feature. These issues will be resolved as we are currently installing additional machines to handle the load.

Mail-to-Blogger is not currently working and should be back up shortly.

Update: This has been resolved.

Blog*Spot is currently unreachable and we are working get it back up.

Update: Blog*Spot is back up. However, those of you who own domains associated with a Blog*Spot subdomain will not be able to reach your site unless you use its Blog*Spot address. We are tackling this problem right now.

Update: Blog*Spot is fully back to normal. We apologize for the downtime earlier and will be adding redundancies to prevent this kind of problem going forward.

entry.title: Downtime
entry.content:
Due to a machine instability, we are now recovering from approximately 40 minutes of unscheduled downtime.

We're continuing to make improvements to the system infrastructure to fix problems such as this. I apologize for the inconvenience - please know that we're directing as many resources as possible to prevent this sort of outage.

entry.title: System sluggishness
entry.content:
Over the past few days, we've been working through a problem whereby the site will occassionally appear slow and unresponsive.

In order to improve the situation, we've had to temporarily disable the editing of profiles including the ability to change passwords. This is only a short-term measure as we work on the underlying issue.

entry.title: Planned Outage Sunday
entry.content: As posted on the homepage, we will be down for upgrades starting at Sunday 3pm for about 2 hours.

entry.title: Mail Send problem
entry.content: We're currently having trouble with our outbound mailserver. This has disabled the BlogSend feature and also prevented support tickets from being filed. We are working on this problem.

entry.title: Blog*Spot Outage
entry.content:
Blog*Spot is currently not responding and we are working to restore service.

Update: Blog*Spot was unavailable for about 30 minutes but is now serving again. We apologize for the outage.

entry.title: bStats unavailable
entry.content:
bStats is currently unavailable and we are working to bring it back up.

Update: Stats is back up.

entry.title: Blog*Spot not answering on www
entry.content:
Blog*Spot is currently not serving when a domain is pre-pended with www. To clarify, www.subdomain.blogspot.com will not serve but subdomain.blogspot.com will. You can view your blogs by removing the www and we are working to restore access.

Update: This issue has been resolved. You may need to clear your browser's cache if you still cannot access your page at www.subdomain.blogspot.com.

entry.title: Saturday Blog*Spot publishing problems
entry.content: There were widespread problems with publishing on Saturday as a critical part of the server infrastructure fell down. I apolgize that we didn't have a status update on this problem sooner; it was resolved quickly after being detected and we are making additional changes to make sure this particular problem doesn't happen again.

entry.title: Exceptions when accessing blogs or settings

link.title: Exceptions when accessing blogs or settings

entry.content: We are recovering from a faulty application push. This build caused issues for some users when trying to access their blogs from the blogger homepage or when trying to access the settings tabs.

entry.title: Blog*Spot Update
entry.content:
By way of additional info, this problem is a by-product of a change we made to the Blog*Spot infrastructure a little while back. Since that time, Blog*Spot has, by and large, been more reliable and faster. However, one remaining troublespot is the vulnerability of a particular filer. We're in process of retiring this filer which will make the whole service much more rock solid.

It is our highest priority to make Blog*Spot as quick and responsive as possible - the work we're doing now specifically addresses those goals. Thanks for bearing with us as we address this problem.
The filer problem has reoccurred and is being worked as I write this.

entry.title: Blog*Spot Outage
entry.content: There was a Blog*Spot outage this morning due to a bad filer. We've worked around the problem and all sites should once again be accessible.

entry.title: DB load
entry.content:
One of our production databases is showing a lot of load this morning and is causing instability in the system. We are quickly addressing the situation and apologize to those users who run into trouble.

Update: We've recovered from the issue that caused this problem.

entry.title: Brief Blog*Spot outage
entry.content: There was an outage of about 15 minutes just now as an old Blog*Spot filer was temporarily unreachable. We are sunsetting these machines in favor of more plentiful and more new alternates. This will be better for all.

entry.title: stats.blogger.com
entry.content: stats.blogger.com is currently behaving erratically. It will load on subsequent attempts and we are looking into the problem.

entry.title: Mail-to-blogger and API trouble
entry.content:
Because of a configuration change, mail-to-blogger and some API clients are currently not working. We will fix this problem shortly.

Update: mail-to-blogger has been fixed. API clients are still broken as the end point unfortunately changed. If you point your clients to http://www.blogger.com/api or http://www.blogger.com/api/RPC2 they will work. We apologize for the unplanned change to the end-point and we will make http://new.blogger.com/api work again as well.

entry.title: Blog*Spot outage
entry.content:
We're having some intermittent Blog*Spot downtime which we are working with data center techs to resolve.

Update: This has been fixed.

entry.title: SFTP problem
entry.content:
Users of SFTP will get a "transfer error" message even though their blogs published successfully. We are working to fix this problem.

Update: This has been fixed.

entry.title: Blogger downtime
entry.content:
Due to a database change, Blogger was unaccessible for 10-15 minutes this morning. We apologize for the downtime.

We will have a planned maintenance this evening at 8pm in order to implement this database change.

entry.title: DNS Problems
entry.content: Blogger.com and Blogspot.com are not addressable for lots of people because of a DNS snafu. (DNS are the computers that tell your computer what number to go to when you put in a name.) The fix has been pushed, but it could take a while to refresh everywhere. Meanwhile, if you're geeky, you can change your host file to get to Blogger (point new.blogger.com to 66.102.15.100).

entry.title: Blog*Spot blogs not publishing
entry.content: Some users are noticing that new posts are not appearing on Blog*Spot pages. The posts are being saved and we should have the publishing problem resolved soon.

entry.title: Blog*Spot Admin unavailable
entry.content: Logging into the Blog*Spot admin panel is currently unavailable and we are working to fix it.

entry.title: Settings unavailable
entry.content:
Some users are seeing a problem whereby clicking on the settings tab will return an error. We are working to fix this problem - as a workaround, you can clear your browser's cache and this will fix the problem. In Internet Explorer, to clear your cache you access Tools | Internet Options and choose Delete Files from the Temporary Internet Files section.

Update: This has been fixed.

entry.title: Tabs unavailable
entry.content: Some users are experiencing a problem whereby the tabs and posting options do not appear in the application interface. We're working to correct this. As a workaround, you can use the alternate posting interface by going to your profile and deselecting the Use Classic checkbox.

entry.title: Up and Down and Up
entry.content: Blogger may be intermittently unavailable for the next few minutes while we continue to improve Your Blogging Experience. Trust us: it'll be worth the wait.
We are going to attempt to push a new version of Blogger. If you notice any problems, please file a support ticket

entry.title: Blogger Outage
entry.content: Blogger was unavailable for a couple hours this morning due to a bad build from which we have now recovered. We apologize for the unscheduled dowtime.

entry.title: Brief Blogger outage
entry.content: There was a brief Blogger outage of about 10 minutes this afternoon because of a database connectivity problem. We've now resolved the issue.

entry.title: Brief blog outage
entry.content: For about the last 20 minutes, some users would have seen an internal server error when accessing their blogs. This was due to a database connection problem that has no been resolved.

entry.title: Blogger unavailable
entry.content:
Due to problems with our service provider, Blogger and Blog*Spot have been intermittantly unavailble. We're working with datacenter technicians to fix the problem and apologize for the downtime.

Update: These problems are due to faulty equipment on the part of the datacenter. They have replaced the problem equipment and are following up with additional tests to prevent this from happening.

entry.title: Inability to access blogs
entry.content:
Some users are currently unable to access their blogs to create new posts. We are working to restore the server that has caused this problem.

Update: This problem has been resolved.

entry.title: Scheduled downtime
entry.content: Blogger will be unavailable for a few hours starting at 11pm (Pacific) on Wednesday, November 12 due to scheduled maintenance. Thanks for your patience.

entry.title: Invites
entry.content: Some users are reporting a problem when accepting invites to group blogs. We're looking in to the problem.

entry.title: Planned Maintenance pt. II
entry.content: Blogger will be unavailable for approximately 15 minutes starting at 8am (Pacific) on Sunday, November 2.

entry.title: Planned Maintenance
entry.content: Due to planned maintenance, Blogger will be unavailable for a few hours starting at 11pm (Pacific) on Wednesday, October 29. Thanks in advance for your understanding.

entry.title: bStats outage
entry.content: bStats is currently offline and we are working to restore service.

entry.title: Plus site outage
entry.content: Approximately 10% of Blog*Spot Plus sites will be unavailable for a few minutes starting at 2pm Pacific Time.

entry.title: Outage
entry.content: We've had some brief outages this morning and are working to stabilize the system.

entry.title: MailtoBlogger
entry.content: Posts through mail-to-Blogger will not go through for a small number of users right now until we make a fix...

entry.title: Blog*Spot archives
entry.content:
We have had to take the archive pages for most Blog*Spot sites offline. We are in the process of gradually bringing them back and hope to do so as quickly as possible.


update: archives are back-up as of 10:37 AM.

entry.title: Downtime
entry.content: Apologies for the brief downtime this afternoon - users were receiving errors upon login. This problem has been resolved.

entry.title: Blog*Spot archives
entry.content: We have had to take the archive pages for most Blog*Spot sites offline. We are in the process of gradually bringing them back and hope to do so as quickly as possible.

entry.title: Blog*Spot Sluggishness
entry.content: Blog*Spot's currently experiencing sluggishness and we're working to fix the problem.
The BlogSpot filer is having problems now which we are currently working to fix.
BlogSpot has been experiencing difficulties for 15 minutes or so. This problem will be resolved shortly.

entry.title: New Blog Creation
entry.content: For some users, trying to create a new blog will fail. We are investigating the problem.

entry.title: DoS
entry.content: Blogger and Blog*Spot experienced downage today due to too many packets being sent our way. We're mostly back up. Still looking into some things.

entry.title: Logging In
entry.content:
We are experiencing problems when users try to log-in to Blogger. We're working to fix the issue as quickly as possible and will update this post when it is fixed.

Update: This is now resolved - we apologize for the downtime.
There is a BlogSpot-wide networking problem currently occurring which started a little over an hour ago. Full resources are being devoted to this problem at this time.

Currently, BlogSpot is having troubles. Some blogs are reachable while others are not. We are fixing the problem and will update this blog once things are back online. We apologize for the inconvenience.
BlogSpot is coming back online now.

entry.title: Blog*Spot issue
entry.content: Blog*Spot is experiencing difficulties right now. We will post an update when this has been remedied.

entry.title: Support
entry.content: We're having trouble with the co-lo that hosts our support system and knowledge base. This is causing help.blogger.com to be temporarily unreachable. We're working to get this resolved very quickly.

entry.title: Blog*Spot disk full errors
entry.content:
Starting yesterday morning, Blog*Spot users started seeing Disk Full errors when publishing. This only affected the publication of archive pages.

This error should no longer be seen - apologies to those who were confused when their archive links didn't work.

entry.title: Unexpected BlogSpot downtime
entry.content:
We're currently experiencing some unexpected BlogSpot downtime. We're sorry for the inconvenience, we'll be back up ASAP.

Update: This has been taken care of. Thank you for your patience.

entry.title: 500 Error
entry.content:
We're working to eliminate the 500 errors that are popping up upon publication. Posts are not being lost - just not published.

Update: This has been addressed.

entry.title: bStats
entry.content:
bStats is currently returning an error upon sign-in. We are investigating the problem.

Update: Stats are back online.

entry.title: Application Restart
entry.content:
We are currently in the process of restarting Blogger. We apologize for the downtime.

Update: We're back.

entry.title: Host Exception
entry.content:
Some users are seeing a java.net.UnknownHostException error on publishing. This is due to a faulty server which we are in the process of replacing.

Update: This has been fixed.

entry.title: Blog*Spot Down
entry.content: Publishing and viewing of Blog*Spot pages is currently unavailable due to a hardware failure. Fix is underway...

entry.title: Big Post problems
entry.content:
Some users of free Blogger will receive Big Post errors when publishing long posts (greater than 8000 characters). We are working to resolve this problem.

Update: This error has been fixed.

entry.title: Upload File
entry.content:
We are working on an issue wherein links are not being created after a successful File Upload.

Update: This is now fixed.

entry.title: Logging in problems
entry.content:
There are currently issues with accessing blogs after logging in. Users are being repeatedly prompted for username and password. We are working to fix this.

Update: This is now fixed.

entry.title: Team Invites
entry.content: Invites to team blogs are not currently being sent and we are working to restore this functionality.

entry.title: BigBody
entry.content: Some blogs with longer posts have been seeing a [BigBody] placeholder since being moved to the new version of Blogger. The posts have not been lost and we are working to restore the full text.

entry.title: BlogThis!
entry.content:
If you are having trouble using BlogThis! since moving to the new Blogger, it is because you need to use the new version. Here they are:

  • BlogThis! (IE)

  • BlogThis! (Mozilla)

The IE version is not yet compatible with Mac IE and we are working on one that will work for that browser.

entry.title: Mising Upload buttons
entry.content:
There is a problem with the Upload File button such that the option buttons do not appear as clickable from the dialog box. We will be fixing this problem very shortly.

Update: This has been fixed.

entry.title: API tools
entry.content: By Monday, tools using the API will not work for blogs on the old version of Blogger. However, these blogs will be moved to the new version within the next few days. We, therefore, do not anticipate that these third-party tools should be unavailable for more than a day or two.

entry.title: Posted by
entry.content: The BlogItemAuthorNickname tag is not being rendered correctly on some BloggerPro blogs. This results in the posted by footer coming up blank. We are looking into this.

entry.title: Post Migration
entry.content:
Posts are lagging behind migrated dano blogs by several hours. No posts have been lost and we are working to speed up the migration.

Update: Posts have been restored. If you posted to your blog in the interval, you will need to republish your blog.

entry.title: Mail-to-Blogger
entry.content: We're currently working on a publishing problem with Mail-to-Blogger. Sorry for the trouble.

entry.title: Stats Backup
entry.content: bStats are once again online.

entry.title: Missing templates
entry.content:
Many users are receiving a "missing template" error message. This is due to the hardware failure mentioned yesterday and we are working hard to get replacement machines up and running. The templates have not been lost and will be restored to the affected blogs.

Update: This has been fixed.

entry.title: API and bSTATS down
entry.content: A hardware failure has caused the downageness of the API and bSTATS servers. A replacement is in the works.

entry.title: Short Dano Outage
entry.content: We've had a short dano outage for the past 30 minutes. It should be cleared up now. Our apologies for the inconvenience

entry.title: BlogSpot Slowness
entry.content: BlogSpot has been especially sluggish recently and we are working hard to improve the situation. We sincerely apologize that the problem has taken longer to resolve than expected and for the frustration of having poor performance from the servers.

entry.title: Pro ordering
entry.content: BloggerPro ordering has been temporarily disabled. Some orders had been placed but unfulfilled and we are working to correct those mistakes.
About 42 minutes ago we had another switch failure. We've replaced the device and are now going through the various services to verify that they are all back online.

entry.title: Pro Database
entry.content: Last night, BloggerPro was reporting intermittent errors on publishing and checking settings. These problems have been resolved.

entry.title: Template Trouble
entry.content: As a result of the template fix made last night, older templates would be seen in the editting view. This did not affect how the blog was published and has now been fixed.

entry.title: Missing Templates
entry.content: Templates were briefly unavailable for editting this evening. This did not affect publishing and has now been fixed.

Starting early this morning (about 6 hours ago) there was a serious problem affecting a number of applications including publishing and Blog*Spot. Resolving the problem took a number of reboots and reconfiguration of a server due to what is now looking to be a hardware problem with its network card. All services should be available again at this time.

entry.title: Upload
entry.content: Throughout the day there were intermittent problems with the Upload File function. While we were able to quickly resolve this problem for BloggerPro users, BlogSpot Plus users were still affected until late in the day. The Upload File feature should now be working for all Pro/Plus users and we're sorry for the bother.

entry.title: Template Update
entry.content:
We've fixed the publishing problems from this morning. There are still some users for whom the wrong template is being served and we'll be restoring them from backups. If you are seeing the wrong template with your blog, please create an issue in Control to let us know that you need to be restored from backup.

We're really sorry for the trouble ... we'll be working hard to make sure it all gets put right very quickly.

entry.title: Template Trouble
entry.content: Related to the publishing trouble Rudy mentioned, we're seeing cases where a blog's template has been swapped with that of another. This does not mean that your blog was compromised; we're working to put all templates back in their proper places.
The publishing server for non-pro has had serious hardware failure and we are in the process of trying to restore it.
One of the publishing servers was unable to resolve domain names after a dns outage. This is fixed and publishes on that machine are working great now. We're sorry for the inconvenience.

entry.title: Pro1 Problems
entry.content: Users who had been relying on pro1.blogger.com for publishing are running into problems with missing archive templates. Instead of the valid archive template, a server error message is displayed. We are working to fix this for those who need pro1 for its ability to publish using active FTP. In the meantime, you will be able to publish if you disable archives.

entry.title: Pinging Weblogs.com
entry.content: Some BloggerPro users were noticing that the changes.xml published by weblogs.com didn't include their blogs (despite having the ping weblogs setting marked as 'yes'). This has been fixed.

entry.title: BlogSpot Load
entry.content:
As expected, people have been blogging and reading blogs a lot more in the past few days. We're adding more machines to BlogSpot to deal with the increased load. Until those machines are online, we apologize for the sluggishness you may encounter.

Update: Rudy has brought more servers online and we're seeing increased performance on BlogSpot as a result. Thanks, Rudy!

entry.title: Mail-to-Blogger
entry.content:
The mail-to-blogger feature of BloggerPro has been completely reworked and all users should notice a signifcant increase in reliability. Specifically, the mail-to-blog address can be put in the bcc: field of your email, ensuring that your secret mail-to-blog email address remains secret. Also, emails can be formatted as plain text, html or multi-part which will resolve problems users were having with email sent from Exchange.

Please note that 
 tags should not be used in html-formatted email and  tags should not contain parameters.  If you're experiencing other problems, please create a BloggerPro issue in Control.
      

      
Thanks to Misha for rewriting this important feature and to Rudy for setting-up and administering our new mail server.

entry.title: Missing template images
entry.content: BlogSpot Plus users were seeing a problem where template images would be lost after upgrading a blog to Plus. This was due to a problem with the migration routine and won't happen going forward. However, some users who have already upgraded may still see broken image links in their templates - Rudy is working to clean up this problem.

entry.title: New blog creation
entry.content: Non-Blogger Pro users were seeing a "oops, blog not ready" error message when trying to publish newly created blogs. We're sorry for the time it took to resolve this problem.

entry.title: Double login
entry.content: Pro users were being prompted to login twice to access their blogs. This has been fixed.

Blogger/Blog*Spot is now recovering from hardware failure on a critical switch. This is not the problem seen earlier this week with a database server, but instead was a problem with network connectivity between the various application/database servers.

The switch experienced total failure, which is especially surprising given that it was a brand new HP ProCurve device. Luckily there was a backup device which Cable&Wireless was able to move the network cables to (BTW: thanks, Marc Rose, you're the man). It took about thirty minutes for me to get to a computer to be able to troubleshoot and report the problem, and another thirty minutes or so to recover.

There was a system failure this morning with one of the database servers. This was affecting Pro users after logging in, when trying to go to a specific blog (it also broke the recently updated list).

While this kind of problem is rare, there are plans in motion to prevent it from happening again (we just need some time at this point). I'm also going to try to tweak our monitoring agents to keep a closer eye on this specific server.

entry.title: API Publishing
entry.content: We made a fix to the API publishing. It's working better now.
A new server was brought online for BlogSpot which was causing problems with double banner ads in basic BlogSpot blogs. If you are seeing this, please try republishing.

Good Guy Hacker Adrian Lamo got ahold of us a few weeks ago to let us know of a few security holes he found. We checked through the logs and none of them appear to have been used before Adrian found them. We have fixed the security issues and Blogger is better for it. Adrian rocks for not only finding the problem but also for letting us know about them so other people won't be affected. Thank you, Adrian.

entry.title: Error messages
entry.content: Some may see a "msxml3.dll error" upon publishing - this is due to excess load on the server and we're adding machines to deal with the problem. Simply repost for the time being - a blank error message may result but this should not affect the correct publication of your blog.
Mail2Blogger is currently broken. We're working on it.

entry.title: Moving templates
entry.content:
We're moving templates to a new server, for greater reliability, which affects your ability to edit them, and create new blogs, but not to publish. Right now, we're just doing Pro. Should be about a half-hour hour.

Update: We're done with that. Still looking at API.

entry.title: BlogSend
entry.content: BlogSend is currently not working in Blogger Pro. We're working to fix this.

entry.title: Blog*Spot Plus
entry.content: We have been deploying much-needed hardware in the last week or so. We're now moving Blog*Spot plus sites to a better/newer file server. This will be a gradual process starting with the highest bandwidth and highest traffic hosted sites first.

entry.title: Blog This
entry.content: The Blog This feature has recently been disabled ... we'll be getting it back online right away.

entry.title: Ad Free
entry.content:
The ads have not been removed from some users' blogs who ordered Ad Free removal in the past week. We're working on this now to make sure all orders are successfully processed.

Update: This has been fixed. You'll need to republish your blog to have the ads removed. If ads still appear on your archives, republish those as well.

entry.title: RSS
entry.content: RSS feeds hadn't been updating for some Pro users for a couple days due to a migration problem. This has been fixed.

entry.title: Encoding Characters
entry.content:
Blogger Pro users are seeing a problem with the encoding of special charcters such as accents or smart quotes. We're working to quickly fix this.

Status: Fixed - if you're seeing misrendering of special characters, please republish your blog.

entry.title: Blogger Pro Publishing
entry.content: This morning, Blogger Pro users were running into a "server busy" error when trying to publish. We're sorry about this - it's now been fixed.

entry.title: BlogSpot Plus Upgrades
entry.content: Any users who upgraded to BlogSpot Plus this morning will have experienced migration problems. We are working through these orders to make sure that these blogs publish successfully.

entry.title: Names not showing up
entry.content: There was a problem with "posted by" names not showing up for free blogs. A hangover from database upgrades last night. It's fixed now. If you republish, the names will come back.

entry.title: Maintenance Sunday night
entry.content:
WARNING: Blogger will be down for maintenance for a couple hours, starting at 7pm (PST) tonight, while we upgrade some hardware. Your patience is appreciated.

Update: It took longer than usual (as usual), but everything is back. We upgraded one of the major databases to much, much better hardware, which should speed everything up, as well as give us room to grow.

entry.title: Upload Update
entry.content: The File Upload permissions error has been resolved.

The BlogSpot "Page Not Found" problem should be corrected now. It was an unintended consequence of the addition of a new BlogSpot fileserver. (Re-publishing should have corrected the problem before it was fixed.)

Sincere apologies for any inconvenience this caused. The new fileserver was a desperately needed enhancement to the service and should improve the reliability of BlogSpot.

entry.title: RSS feed added for this site

link.title: RSS feed added for this site

entry.content: If you are using an RSS reader, you will be happy to learn this page is now available in RSS here.

entry.title: BlogSpot Not Showing Up?
entry.content: If your blog on blog*spot is not showing up when you go to the URL, try publishing it again. We're looking into why this is happening on some blogs.

entry.title: API Publishing
entry.content:
We made a change to the API that should fix publishing for many blogs that were having trouble through the API.

Also, the API now uses the regular Pro publishing server for Pro blogs, so the BlogItemTitle tag shouldn't be a problem and RSS files will be published.

entry.title: File Uploading
entry.content: Some users are running into a problem with the upload file function. A permissions error is being returned instead of successful upload. We're working to fix this.

entry.title: Status
entry.content:
Okay, the new database server isn't ready yet, so we're not doing that today. Perhaps tomorrow.

Meanwhile, we just put in a new switch that should help with some intermittent connectivity problems. Monitoring now.

entry.title: Scheduled upgrades
entry.content: If all goes well, we will be moving one of the central databases tomorrow. This will result in some down time, unfortunately. We will post a warning ahead of time, when we know more specifically when it will be.

entry.title: Deluge!
entry.content:
Hi, folks. As you may imagine, we're getting a bit of a deluge, because of the Google announcement. We're working on it with all our might. Temporarily, we've shut new blog creation off to make some DB tweaks, as well as publishing for free blogs. They should be back up in a few minutes.

And we have more servers on the way. Thanks for your patience. Things are about to get a lot better, despite tons more users.

Update: New blog creation and free publishing is back on.
I just fixed a problem with new Pro blogs that would cause an error when going to settings/publishing.
We had a database go down a little while ago which affected Pro publishing. Things are back online now and good to go. We're sorry for the inconvenience.

The control support tool has been taken offline for some critical repair work. Apologies for the inconvenience; it will be back a.s.a.p.

Update: It's back.

entry.title: bStats database
entry.content: There was a glitch with the stats database which is now corrected.

entry.title: bStats is available again.
entry.content: During the bStats outage, it continued recording hits so you shouldn't have lost any traffic data. We're sorry for the inconvenice.

entry.title: Note to expiring Pro users
entry.content: Note to expiring Pro users: We launched Blogger Pro at the and of January last year. That means, some accounts are up for renewal. Don't worry: a) We don't automatically charge credit cards for year-long subscriptions. Will present you a message when it's time to renew. b) We're going to let expired accounts slide for a little while, while we get some fixes in place and new stuff out the door.

entry.title: Fixed invite bug.
entry.content: Just fixed an invite-related bug that was incorrrectly stating that invites were already used when they hadn't been.

entry.title: RoadRunner
entry.content: Unfortunately, it appears that RoadRunner is now blocking FTP from any non-RoadRunner IP's (including Blogger) to it's home.nc.rr.com server where many RoadRunner uses host their blogs. If this is affecting you, we encourage you to write to customercare@va.rr.com. We'll keep up the pressure from our end and work on a solution.
Shortly we will be taking the API and bStats servers down briefly for a memory upgrade. The downtime should be just a few minutes.

This morning there were problems for basic blogger users when trying to go to a specific blog after logging in. This problem was identified and corrected.

Pro was also just now brought down temporarily for a database reboot due to sporadic network card problems on a database server. It is back up now.

There are problems with bStats and Control which are being worked at the moment. (Stats are still being recorded, but not reported properly, based on what has been determined so far.)
Publishing and templates are back, thanks to Rudy's exhausting work. We're assessing the situation now...

Non-pro publishing is currently broken, due to a template server issue. We'll try to have it fixed first thing in the morning. Pro publishing should be working (but only if you were Pro before this happened).

Also, for anyone who ordered Pro in the last couple weeks and your coupon for pyRads wasn't working, please try it again. (Sorry for the trouble. We gave you 12,000 extra impressions for the trouble.)
File Uploading was broken. Now it's fixed.
pyRads is back and working better.

entry.title: pyRads trouble
entry.content: pyRads is having some trouble, so we took them off the home page temporarily.

Some people have set up a new Yahoo group for user-to-user Blogger support. This not official or attended by Blogger staff. We're working on a better help system, as we speak. However, for those needing more support than we can currently provide, it might not be a bad place to look. Thanks.

entry.title: Security Update.
entry.content:
For those still wondering about the hacker incident from a week-1/2 ago, our investigation has uncovered new information, all of it reassuring. Immediately after the attack, we patched some potential vulnerabilities we discovered in our network and made some tweaks to our application that would make a similar attack extremely unlikely, if not impossible. And based on the evidence we had at the time, we thought it unlikely that the assailant did more than update information in the databasee.g., gained access to information, such as passwords, ftp logins, credit cards, etc. However, that was a best-guess at the time and we hadn't yet done a full-scale investigation. Based on our newest discoveries about how the attack was perpetrated, we can much more assuredly rule out the possibility that sensitive information was gathered.

There was the window, of course, during when the site was still up and the passwords were changed (about 7-9 am), during which, if someone was aware of this, and wanted to target you directly, and knew your username, they could have logged in as you. This is bad, of course, but still highly unlikely for almost all users (that no one targeted me, with probably an extremely easy-to-guess username and access to the Blogger home page, among other things, is a strong indication of that).

I don't want to trivialize it. We take all security threats, let alone incidents, extremely seriously. But the real damage of this attack, despite the attention it got, was pretty minimal. And, of course, it has resulted in us being even more security-aware. We have tightened up our code and configurations to further limit the chances of a more serious attack in the future.

Thank you for your understanding.
For those doing FTP-IP blocking, a new publishing server has been added at 216.34.7.190.
Pro.blogger.com seems to be responding properly now to all clients. The issue turned on some unexpected behavior with the load balancing system. Again, apologies for this inconvenience.

Some users are unable to connect to pro.blogger.com. This problem apparently started this morning. I've seen this myself from an XO connection, and have confirmed it with another internet provider account (via Speakeasy) but apparently it is not affecting clients with other ISPs such as ATTBI. This problem has been reported to the internet provider for the pro servers and it is currently being worked. In addition, as this problem is not affecting another IP of the pro server, I've implemented a DNS change to point the pro.blogger.com domain to the unaffected IP, in case all else fails in the efforts today. Many apologies for any inconvenience.

entry.title: Update
entry.content:
The API is back up, for the most part. I'm still working on bSTATS.

Update: bSTATS is back online, as well.

entry.title: Yikes.
entry.content:
Blogger has suffered a security intrusion by a "haX0r." We have all the data that was changed backed up within a couple hours of the attack, so we can have things pretty much back to normal soon. Of course, we're assessing the situation as thoroughly as possible to make sure it doesn't happen again. Also, if you store your FTP login information in Blogger, it wouldn't hurt to change that on your serverthough it is unlikely that information was accessed. Sorry for the inconvenience.

Update: We have found the cause of the vulnerability and have patched it. Everything is back restored and back online with the exception of the API server and bSTATS.

Just fixed a blog*spot outage that was affecting most, but not all visitors. Sorry for the delay. Our kick-ass system administrator, who is always on top of such things, is having a rare respite, and I failed to adequately pick up the slack. Will pay closer attention now...
All our efforts right now are going into finishing up the new version of Blogger, which we'll finally be able to address a lot of the outstanding issues in. Expect something within two weeks.

entry.title: Pro2 not resolving.
entry.content:
There seems to be some sort of DNS problem. Pro2.blogger.com is not resolving. I've switched pointers to it to Pro4.blogger.com, which is the same thing. Going to
Register (who does the DNS) to see what's up...

entry.title: Time shifting bug gone
entry.content: Fixed: Some blog's entries were dated too early by a single hour.

Blog*Spot Maintenance Report: Thank you for your patience this morning while the Blog*Spot file server was being serviced. The work was about 30 minutes overtime, but apart from this it went very well (in spite of a few unforeseen obstacles). We are seeing results already, with a significant easing of the load on the application/web servers and a higher and more consistently sustained level of data transfer through the network.

Blog*Spot maintenance is scheduled for Tuesday, September 24 from 4:30 a.m. to 7:30 a.m. Pacific time (7:30 a.m. to 10:30 a.m. Eastern). Sincere apologies for any inconvenience this causes. The load on the Blog*Spot servers has been growing at an unexpectedly increasing rate over the last few weeks, and today we saw the most stress yet. The work tomorrow should improve the performance of the Blog*Spot file server, and this should help overall performance, pending the addition of more web servers.
